excerpts: Amazing chicken and shrimp crepe.
Came out crispy and full of all the ingredients listed.
Comes with lettuce, basil and some shredded carrots.
chicken and shrimp crepe.author: Lyman C.
chicken and shrimp crepe.review:
Amazing chicken and shrimp crepe. Came out crispy and full of all the ingredients listed. Comes with lettuce, basil and some shredded carrots. I would come here just for this dish alone. 

I also ordered the crab and tomato noodle soup. It's was good. Definitely made differently from other places. 

I would definitely come back anytime. Lunch time wasn't too busy. Not sure about dinner.

excerpts: \\ Shrimp Rice Krispies - Shrimp Cakes with water chestnut, sweet rice crust, served with peanut sauce.
shrimp rice krispies.author: Candice G.
shrimp rice krispies.review:
Braiiinz. 
Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab Braiiinz.

Overall the food was good, nothing was a super stand-out and the Dungeness was kind of just aight all things considered, but the garlic noodles served underneath with crab brains mixed in was the absolute highlight and luckily they don't skimp on that. 

I thought the garlic roasted crab itself was just okay- definitely not one of the meatier crab meals I've had this season, and the flavor wasn't as bold as I was hoping, but for the price it wasn't bad at all. 

Our group of 5 got a few dishes all to share and the meal with drinks and minus tip came out to $25 a person. 

Our dishes:

\\ Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab - Dungeness crab pan fried in browned & garlic with egg noodles. As mentioned the browned & garlic egg noodles with the crab brains were the table favorite, but the crab itself was just alright.

\\ Shrimp Rice Krispies - Shrimp Cakes with water chestnut, sweet rice crust, served with peanut sauce. I'd 100% get these again. 

\\ House Fried Rice - Duck and pineapple stir-fried rice seasoned with scallions and garlic. Not a huge fan. Was a bit too dry and too salty even for me, a person who would sneak into my grandma's car to lick the salt block she kept in the trunk to weigh down the back half of the car as a child.

\\ Imperial Rolls - Pork, mushroom, carrots, lightly fried, served with fresh vegetables & fish sauce. Again, these were just ok. A little too dry for my tastes. 

\\ Tofu Eggplant - Bean curd, eggplant, bell peppers in soy sauce, served with rice. It was just fine but not a standout dish by any means. 

Drink:
\\ Young Coconut - So freaking good. Served in the coconut, so fresh and only $4. Def helped cure my hangover from the night before.

If I could give 3.5 stars I would, but I can't. Based off the dozen or so specialty whole crab dishes I've had for my first crab season living in the bay area, I have to say that while this crab wasn't bad, it so far has been the least impressive, but the price was reasonable, the place is cute, decor is warm, service was fine, and the bathrooms were immaculate and bigger than my apartment.

excerpts: We got the Shrimp Rice Krispies for appetizers which didn't have a whole lot of flavor and kinda had a weird texture but was cool to try.
shrimp rice krispies.author: Alysha F.
shrimp rice krispies.review:
An interesting find in the City. Not your typical Vietnamese joint with mainly pho and vermicelli, Le Soleil actually deviates a lot from the traditional Vietnamese foods to more specialty items. 

There's a decent amount of street parking along the entire block which is convenient. The decor of the restaurant is classy without being uptight. We got the Shrimp Rice Krispies for appetizers which didn't have a whole lot of flavor and kinda had a weird texture but was cool to try. For my dinner I got the Caramelized Sea Bass and it was delicious. It was a soy glazed sea bass with a side of brussel sprouts and rice. The sea bass was packed with flavor without being fishy. I would definitely not mind paying Le Soleil another visit

excerpts:
Favorites: Things you have to try 
Shrimp Rice Krispies
Chilean Caramelized Sea Bass with Brussel Sprouts 
and ask about the Fried Crab or Lobster.
You won't regret it.
shrimp rice krispies.author: Lexie S.
shrimp rice krispies.review:
I love coming to this place with my husband and friends.  I've never had a bad meal.  The food is great and so is the service.  We never make reservations and so far it's worked out for us.  

Favorites: Things you have to try 
Shrimp Rice Krispies
Chilean Caramelized Sea Bass with Brussel Sprouts 
and ask about the Fried Crab or Lobster.  You won't regret it.

excerpts: Shrimp Rice Krispies  and it was served with peanut sauce like many other Vietnamese restaurants but the presentation here is very pretty.
shrimp rice krispies.author: Anita S.
shrimp rice krispies.review:
This restaurant is right in the heart of Richmond close to all the stores on Clement Street.  Upon entering the restaurant I was shocked to see how beautiful the interior is.  It is elegantly decorated and it has a zen like feel.  I feel comfortable and very relax right away.  

The menu offers many unique dishes.  I was intrigued to see something like Escargot Noodle Soup.  Every dish looks enticing that I want to sample them all.  We ordered a lot for just three people.  We started off with some appetizers.  Shrimp Rice Krispies  and it was served with peanut sauce like many other Vietnamese restaurants but the presentation here is very pretty.  The  Imperial Roll is like no others, it is authentic not a Spring Roll wanna be Imperial Roll. 

We ordered their lunch special  Lemongrass Beef served with Chicken Coconut Soup for $10.  We had the Escargot Noodle Soup, Beef Pho, Roast Duck & Pineapple Fried Rice and Chicken & Shrimp Crispy Noodle.  The food presents well with a touch of fusion look (see photos).  My husband will die for the Imperial Rolls.  I fell in love with the crispy noodle dish.   The food was amazing. It is so good that I'm giving this place 5 stars.   I want to add another star for excellent service if I could give it 6 stars.

excerpts:
Beef Carpaccio with shrimp chips

Shrimp rice krispies-basically shrimp balls with rice that is fried on the outside

BBQ pork spring rolls-delish.
shrimp rice krispies.author: Karen H.
shrimp rice krispies.review:
I been coming here for over 10 years. This place has really updated their menu and remodeled nicely. 

Love the food here. 

Beef Carpaccio with shrimp chips

Shrimp rice krispies-basically shrimp balls with rice that is fried on the outside

BBQ pork spring rolls-delish. Taste just like Dragon Fly's, but missing the crunchy stuff

Lotus Root Salad

Shaken Beef

Seabass with brussel sprouts

Garlic Noodle-wish it was the thicker  noodle. They use ramen noodles. 

Great food, good service, and affordable prices

excerpts: The Chicken Lollipops $9 are a great starter.
There were 5 chicken wings accompanied with sriracha aioli.
The wings were cooked and seasoned well.
It was soo good and great way to start my meal.
chicken lollipops.author: Benita M.
chicken lollipops.review:
This place was great. I like the decor, food was delicious, and service was excellent.

The Chicken Lollipops $9 are a great starter. There were 5 chicken wings accompanied with sriracha aioli. The wings were cooked and seasoned well. It was soo good and great way to start my meal. Next I had the House Fried Rice $13. It was a nice portion for the price. The duck wasn't dry but it was a little tasteless. The fried rice was made perfectly. Although I'm more used to the flavors of King of Thai's Duck Fried Rice, this is a good choice. I also tried the Garlic noodles. It was good, but I feel that it lacked garlic flavor. It tasted more like a chow mein. For sure will return in the future.

excerpts: I love their chicken lollipops.
They're lightly battered and salted just right.
I travel far just for them.
The service rocks and everything else I've had in the menu was tasty, too.
chicken lollipops.author: Lisa P.
chicken lollipops.review: I love their chicken lollipops. They're lightly battered and salted just right. I travel far just for them. The service rocks and everything else I've had in the menu was tasty, too.

excerpts: My little guys love the garlic noodles and the chicken lollipops.
chicken lollipops.author: Hanster P.
chicken lollipops.review: Update: I make any out of town visitors come here at least once and they always fall in love! The food is so consistently good. The lunch specials are a steal for the amount of food that you get! My little guys love the garlic noodles and the chicken lollipops. There are too many great choices on the menu for me to pick a favorite, but I definitely recommend that you always start with the bbq pork spring rolls!

excerpts: The server took her time to explain the menu and recommended Chicken Lollipops, the Curry Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles with Prawns.
chicken lollipops.author: Monica H.
chicken lollipops.review:
Delicious food and friendly service! 

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Saturday night. The server took her time to explain the menu and recommended Chicken Lollipops, the Curry Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles with Prawns. We also ordered the Quail, which one of servers torched at the table. Cool presentation! 

Everything was fantastic, especially the Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles. I definitely recommend coming here.

excerpts: My favorites are the Chicken Lollipops and Vietnamese style Beef Carpaccio with homemade shrimp chips.
(drool).
And the fried banana dessert.
(extra drool).
The imperial rolls are more classic and are equally as yummy.
Garlic noodles are a must.
chicken lollipops.author: Rachael G.
chicken lollipops.review:
I eat here a TON with my family - so it's about time I did a yelp review... it's our go-to Vietnamese restaurant. The food is always consistently amazing and the menu has a great variety of options. The restaurant is casual enough for a quick dinner on a weeknight but also nice enough to take friends on a weekend. The servers are friendly and very attentive and efficient even when they have large parties. 

We always eat family style and get a bunch of things... 
My mom LOVES the beef curry - the beef is breaded and fried and always super tender & the curry itself is full of flavor. 
My favorites are the Chicken Lollipops and Vietnamese style Beef Carpaccio with homemade shrimp chips. (drool). And the fried banana dessert. (extra drool). The imperial rolls are more classic and are equally as yummy. Garlic noodles are a must. 
We always get the green papaya salad to start - its refreshing and light. 

After a few years this is still one of our favorite places to go! Whenever I'm in town we'll always make a point of going back :)

excerpts: I ordered Chicken Lollipops, my goodness taste like heaven
chicken lollipops.author: William D.
chicken lollipops.review: The food was amazing. I took my mom here for her birthday and it was just the best thing ever. I ordered Chicken Lollipops, my goodness taste like heaven The quail appetizer was delicious. My favorite dish I would have to say was the "Shaken Beef" I recommend this plate to anybody that likes meat. The lemon sauce OMG the best thing ever, make sure you dip it in that. The service was great. The waiters always checking up on me, making sure I was okay with my order and everything and always refilling my water. They were so nice and thoughtful. I can't wait to go back!!

excerpts: and i ordered the vegetarian spring rolls ($7) to share...
these were rolls of mushroom, cabbage, carrot, celery wrapped inside thin rice paper, cut into 8 bite size pieces.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Ellen L.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
very nice restaurant for a group setting!  my friends and i, a party of 12, needed a place for a casual lunch, and one of the gals suggested this restaurant in the heart of inner richmond.  this was a GOOD choice b/c we were able to reserve ahead of time and they had a larger, corner table in the back which was perfect for our group, which included 4 babies/toddlers.

we arrived on a sunday afternoon, around 14.00, and the restaurant was fairly full, but not so full that we had a delay in service.  they had many lunch specials, as well as items to order a la carte.

hubby and i ordered the vegetarian spring rolls ($7) to share...these were rolls of mushroom, cabbage, carrot, celery wrapped inside thin rice paper, cut into 8 bite size pieces.  they came with a small side of sweet soy sauce which made for a tasty appetizer, and great start to our meal.

hubby ordered the lemongrass beef special ($13), which came with bbq beef, pickled carrot, mint, bean sprouts, lettuce and chili over a bed of vermicelli noodles.  he thought this was a tasty lunch plate, with great flavors, but he wasn't quite full after finishing his meal.

i ordered the tofu claypot ($12) which was a hot pot of fresh and fried tofu, mixed with assorted mushrooms, onions, and a bit of thai chili.  for a cool day, this was the perfect dish to order to satisfy my stomach.  i wasn't a fan of the fried tofu, but i loved the slightly silken texture of the fresh tofu and mushrooms.  the broth was amazing, not too salty, with a great blend of asian herbs.

service was quite prompt as we didn't have to wait long to order or have food prepared or receive the bill.  our water glasses were filled without us asking.

there was a single women's restroom, and single men's room in the rear, so i actually had to wait a bit, but it wasn't too bad...least the restrooms were kept clean!

parking was a bit of a challenge, esp since there was a farmer's market right outside the restaurant on sunday, but we lucked out and found something about 3 blocks away.

pretty good restaurant with delicious food and reasonable prices, esp for san francisco!

excerpts: I ordered the tofu lunch special which came with a curry coconut milk soup (reminded me of thai curry), vegetarian spring rolls, and slaw.
I also asked for brown rice  instead of white.
It was delicious and filling.
My partner ordered the catfish 'fish and chips' - the batter was light and not overly heavy.
We also ordered the lychee iced tea which was good but watered down due to the amount of ice.
Next time, I would stick with the hot lychee black tea.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Carol W.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
Amazing, high quality Vietnamese- fusion food! We came here for lunch on a weekday and it was busy. 

I ordered the tofu lunch special which came with a curry coconut milk soup (reminded me of thai curry), vegetarian spring rolls, and slaw. I also asked for brown rice  instead of white. It was delicious and filling. My partner ordered the catfish 'fish and chips' - the batter was light and not overly heavy. 
We also ordered the lychee iced tea which was good but watered down due to the amount of ice. Next time, I would stick with the hot lychee black tea. The vietnamese iced coffee was solid. 

There were only two servers thus service was not stellar (they forgot our water). I also disagree with the other reviews on here as they seem to be outdated - prices are competitive to the other Vietnamese restaurants in the neighborhood and even less expensive (pho is $10 and lunch dishes are under $11) considering the quality of food. Definitely give this place a try!

excerpts:
the yelp checkin vegetarian spring rolls deal

vegetarian spring rolls.review:

Plus they use the right amouny of each ingredient and carefully construct each roll to create the "perfect bites". Reminiscent of how good sushi rolls are rolled. Five stars just for this. I could eat Le Soleil's goi cuon every day.

excerpts: We started with the vegetarian spring rolls (he's a vegetarian).
They arrived promptly as he ordered them as soon as we sat down.
The only thing missing was shrimp/pork,
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Chelsea J.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
Fresh, delicious food and great service.

Went here last "night" for the first time since the remodel.  Got there around 5:15 for an early dinner with one of my professors, his pick - but I couldn't be happier.

We started with the vegetarian spring rolls (he's a vegetarian).  They arrived promptly as he ordered them as soon as we sat down.  The only thing missing was shrimp/pork, oh well.

I ordered the 5 spice chicken, which came with rice and a delicious slaw/salad.  I expected a grilled chicken breast - I normally avoid anything fried because it makes me feel lethargic and greasy.  The dish arrived slightly before my professor's, which normally makes me angry, but his followed within 30 seconds - so I was happy.  

The chicken was lightly battered and fried to perfection, perfectly crisp and browned on the outside, juicy on the inside - I believe it was a thigh, brown and white meat, but not greasy at all.  It looked to perfect to disappoint my expectations, and it was tasty.  Not heavy at all, and the slaw that accompanied it was a perfect match - light, crunchy, and flavorful.  And what the hell, it's not as if I have any bikini competitions in the near future.  

A neurotic side note, even the mint was freshly chopped - no browning of the edges (a personal pet peeve).  Oh yeah, the rice was good too - but steamed rice is nothing to write home about unless they really fuck it up, which they didn't.  The server made sure to bring two dishes of shiracha as requested, needing no reminder.

The professor's veggie curry looked good too - lots of broccoli, tofu, and a rich broth.  It also came with rice.  

Overall, a good experience - and I already have plans to return with friends so that I can give their wine and beer list a try whilst enjoying a meal.

excerpts: Yummy vegetarian spring rolls, papaya salad, shaken beef, curry.
Good food, good service, nice ambience.
How can I take off a single point?
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Paula H.
vegetarian spring rolls.review: We found this place on our drive home from the Legion of Honor. Clement Street is thick with restaurants and cafes but parking is scarce. We decided to park first and then look for a restaurant. Someone pulled their car out of a spot and we pulled in, and we found ourselves right in front of Le Soleil. Lucky for us. Checked Yelp to see what others were saying in order to confirm our choice. There were three of us and we ordered this and that and shared. Yummy vegetarian spring rolls, papaya salad, shaken beef, curry. Good food, good service, nice ambience. How can I take off a single point?

excerpts: Enjoyed their version of bun rieu, along with the vegetarian spring rolls.
For the price, the soup was skimpy in portions, but was very good.
The veg.spring rolls was about equal at other Viet restaurants.
Clean place, fast/friendly service is what I encountered.
It's in the less-hectic portion of Clement.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Derek N.
vegetarian spring rolls.review: Enjoyed their version of bun rieu, along with the vegetarian spring rolls. For the price, the soup was skimpy in portions, but was very good. The veg.spring rolls was about equal at other Viet restaurants. Clean place, fast/friendly service is what I encountered. It's in the less-hectic portion of Clement.

excerpts: I had the vegetarian spring rolls and Shaken Beef.
The springs rolls were OK.
The beef was mediocre - every piece was tough at the center.
Two people had the garlic noodles and both said the dish was very salty.
I tried the green papaya salad and it was bland, very little taste of anything.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: David C.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
I came here a couple nights ago with 10 other people as part of a Meetup event.

FOOD:
I had the vegetarian spring rolls and Shaken Beef.  The springs rolls were OK.  The beef was mediocre - every piece was tough at the center.  Two people had the garlic noodles and both said the dish was very salty.  I tried the green papaya salad and it was bland, very little taste of anything.  The lotus root salad was OK.

SERVICE:
Service was pretty bad.  They lost track of two orders, didn't clear the tables completely, had some delays, and had trouble getting the bill correct.  It was a bad combination of an inexperienced server and a large group.

The owner gave all of us a complimentary dessert - I think it was jasmine ice cream with fried bananas.  Not enough to make up for mediocre food and service.

DECOR/CLEANLINESS:
Restaurant was recently renovated and it has very nice minimalist look.  Bathroom was clean.

excerpts: The vegetarian spring rolls are the best in the city, period.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Keith W.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
My wife and I have been coming here for over 20 years, from the time when it was called Garden House. We have never had a bad meal. I don't think they know how to make a bad meal. The vegetarian spring rolls are the best in the city, period. 

The service is also fantastic. They are always friendly and glad to see us. The kitchen gets a little backed-up when they are crowded though, so expect a slower-paced meal at busy times.

I couldn't recommend it more highly.

excerpts: Vietnamese Vegetarian Spring Rolls & brown rice with sm vegetables stir fry hmm yummmmmm cant wait to visit le soleil again
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Ms C.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
decent, clean, casual restaurant with friendly staffs.
my fave here: Vietnamese Vegetarian Spring Rolls & brown rice with sm vegetables stir fry hmm yummmmmm cant wait to visit le soleil again :)

excerpts: Next up were vegetarian spring rolls and the Vietnamese vegetarian crepe, the latter delightfully light and crispy and stuffed full of mushrooms and bean sprouts.
That was actually plenty of food for me right there, but Rico and his friend Jim also ordered main courses of the pan fried rice noodles with prawns and the lemon grass beef, with rice on the side.
And then for dessert I insisted on splitting a fried banana drizzled with honey and accompanied by coconut ice cream.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Heidi D.
vegetarian spring rolls.review:
Back when I lived in the outer outer Richmond, my boyfriend and I had dinner at Le Soleil with almost alarming regularity.  Parking was a bitch, but it was worth it just to stumble in past their giant fish tank at the entrance to breathe in the scent of their vegetarian hot and sour soup on a cold foggy night.  Then I moved to Berkeley, broke up with the boyfriend, and haven't had an excuse to go back in about six years.

Until Saturday night!  My friend Rico was in town from LA and looking for a quintessential SF dining experience, so in a burst of inspiration I suggested Le Soleil.  The decor has improved considerably in the intervening years (no more fish tank!), but the food hasn't changed a bit and is just as fantastic as it ever was.  We started with the aforementioned veggie hot and sour soup, and it came brimming with tomatoes, pineapple, and tofu in a richly aromatic broth.  Next up were vegetarian spring rolls and the Vietnamese vegetarian crepe, the latter delightfully light and crispy and stuffed full of mushrooms and bean sprouts.  That was actually plenty of food for me right there, but Rico and his friend Jim also ordered main courses of the pan fried rice noodles with prawns and the lemon grass beef, with rice on the side.  And then for dessert I insisted on splitting a fried banana drizzled with honey and accompanied by coconut ice cream. There were absolutely no complaints.  

I'm so happy that despite its face-lift the restaurant is the same old Le Soleil I loved back in the day.  I do miss that fish tank though.

excerpts: I recall their vegetarian spring rolls were delish.
vegetarian spring rolls.author: Deb T.
vegetarian spring rolls.review: Fairly reasonably priced, if memory serves.  I recall their vegetarian spring rolls were delish.

excerpts: On top of that, if you love viet food then you'll be pretty upset about the bbq pork spring rolls.
They're PUINY and nothing like what you're expecting.
I figured
hey, I'm spending top dollar (9), for some bbq spring rolls that I crave from socal with the crispys and this place might do it....
NOPE not even fkin close.
The garlic noodles were ok but a little bitter and bland, shaking beef was good tho...sigh so much disappointment for the overall experience.
You're better off going to Yummy Yummy on irving tbh
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Vince L.
bbq pork spring rolls.review: I'm usually all about supporting my chinese-yeeeknam peepo but they REALLY make it hard when common dining etiquettes are crossed.  It was a busy night but the table who came in after us got served the SAME dam thing we ordered BEFORE us.  Annoys the crap out of me.  On top of that, if you love viet food then you'll be pretty upset about the bbq pork spring rolls.  They're PUINY and nothing like what you're expecting.  I figured hey, I'm spending top dollar (9), for some bbq spring rolls that I crave from socal with the crispys and this place might do it....NOPE not even fkin close.  The garlic noodles were ok but a little bitter and bland, shaking beef was good tho...sigh so much disappointment for the overall experience.  You're better off going to Yummy Yummy on irving tbh

excerpts: - BBQ pork spring rolls
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Jenny T.
bbq pork spring rolls.review:
Le Soleil serves traditional Vietnamese cuisine in a quant modernized dining room.  All the wait staff wears black and are extremely friendly.  It's a perfect place to dine for a celebratory reason or for just because...

We booked easily online and was seated right away.  The tables are small and we could barely fit all the dishes served up for us for family style dining.  Or maybe we were just little piggies and should be ordering individual dishes instead.  But none the less, we are Asians, that's just how we roll. Banquet family style is more our to our upbringing.  Plus, we are piggies that wanna taste everything!!  

Each dish that came out was delightfully scumcious!  And here we goooo...

5 STARS - SUPER YUM
! - Lotus root beef salad - the lotus was crunchy with bits of marinated beef drizzled with a light tangy flavor
! - Beef carpaccio with shrimp chips - thinly sliced raw beef with a tangy lime sauce topped with a peppery chopped red onions with deep fried shallots.  You're supposed to eat this with the shrimp chip but I prefer to roll a beef up with onions and shallots, then pop it into my mouth.  It's a explosion of yummies in your mouth
! - Portobello Mushrooms with green beans and Brussels - I could had just eaten this dish alone with a bowl of rice and would had been content!  The portobello shrooms soaked up all the flavors of the sauce, it was tender beyond belief and could easily pass as a protein dish.  The green beans and Brussels were cooked with a slight crunchy texture and was so delicious to eat.  Yum!!

4 STARS - GOOD YUM
! - Shanking beef - this was marinated beef with a lemon pepper dipping sauce.  I wish the sauce had more pepper and lemon, it was a bit drowned out for me
! - Garlic crab with noodles - The crab meat was very fresh but it's not my favorite crab dish.  The noodles were good but again, I've had better.
! - Coconut lemon grass chicken soup - the broth was so good but I thought the chicken got in my way.  I love how there were pineapples found in the soup.

2.5 STARS - OKAY
! - BBQ pork spring rolls - it was okay, nothing special

We each had a glass of wine: Merlot, Sauvignon blanc, Pinot noir, Cabernet 

And the owner found out we were celebrating a birthday and he offered us a free dessert of flan with a lite candle.  That was so nice!

All this came out to $131+tip.  For a birthday celebration, this was a decent outcome, as we've spent wayyy more before.  And we were all content and extremely full!

NOTES:  no cocktail drinks available.  Dessert menu was kinda lame, they need to amp that part up.  Parking was not exactly easy.

excerpts:
Grilled Chicken (perfectly crispy)
BBQ Pork Spring rolls (YUUUUUM)
SeaBass....
my mouth is watering just typing it out...
Garlic noodle (not the usual greasy kind...
it's got more texture...)
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Vee V.
bbq pork spring rolls.review:
4.5 stars...until i try their crab (they were out the other night)

This place is right across from Chapeau on Clement Street. I wanted to try it months ago but never had a chance to. 
What a fantastic place, I love everything on their menu. We had:

Lotus Root Salad =)
Beef Carpaccio, can't get enough of it all over the crispy chip...
Grilled Chicken (perfectly crispy)
BBQ Pork Spring rolls (YUUUUUM)
SeaBass....my mouth is watering just typing it out...
Garlic noodle (not the usual greasy kind...it's got more texture...)
Shaken Beef
Washed it all down with Coconut Juice...

I absolutely luv vietnamese cuisine and Le Soleil def delivered, above n beyond my expectation. Really like the simple yet elegant decor...and all the abacus on the wall!

MUST TRY!

The lunch specials are a steal for the amount of food that you get! My little guys love the garlic noodles and the chicken lollipops. There are too many great choices on the menu for me to pick a favorite, but I definitely recommend that you always start with the bbq pork spring rolls!

excerpts: Wonderful flavors in the beef carpaccio  and the bbq pork spring rolls.
- fresh mint and a chili fish dipping sauce; who could ask for anything more?
The shaking beef was good and the lemon pepper sauce gave another flavor profile to the dish.
This place brings the "Season" all year long.
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Allie P.
bbq pork spring rolls.review: Tis the "season" to indulge in culinary wonders. This place is absolutely remarkable. Wonderful flavors in the beef carpaccio  and the bbq pork spring rolls. - fresh mint and a chili fish dipping sauce; who could ask for anything more? The shaking beef was good and the lemon pepper sauce gave another flavor profile to the dish. This place brings the "Season" all year long.

excerpts:
Beef Carpaccio with shrimp chips

Shrimp rice krispies-basically shrimp balls with rice that is fried on the outside

BBQ pork spring rolls-delish.
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Karen H.
bbq pork spring rolls.review:
I been coming here for over 10 years. This place has really updated their menu and remodeled nicely. 

Love the food here. 

Beef Carpaccio with shrimp chips

Shrimp rice krispies-basically shrimp balls with rice that is fried on the outside

BBQ pork spring rolls-delish. Taste just like Dragon Fly's, but missing the crunchy stuff

Lotus Root Salad

Shaken Beef

Seabass with brussel sprouts

Garlic Noodle-wish it was the thicker  noodle. They use ramen noodles. 

Great food, good service, and affordable prices

excerpts: My friend and I opted for the BBQ pork spring rolls.
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Judy C.
bbq pork spring rolls.review:
I can't believe I've lived in the Richmond area for years and have not heard of Le Soleil.  My friend was telling me that it was recently remodeled - which make sense since the pictures and food mentioned in past Yelp reviews do not resemble what I saw during my visit.

Regardless, the "new version" of Le Soleil is fab!  It's so chic and modern yet not overly pretentious at all.  I know it sounds sort of absurd to love a restaurant's restroom but I really do appreciate the cleanliness and simple decor.  You can always tell how sanitary a restaurant is by its restroom.  As a germaphobe, I was pleased :)

Let's move on to the food!  If you check in on Yelp, you get free spring rolls!  My friend and I opted for the BBQ pork spring rolls.  They were the smallest portions I have ever seen, but I think it might be because they were free. 

For entree, I had the Five Spice Chicken w/ Brown Rice.  What I love about the chicken was that it was perfectly crispy around the edges and super juicy on the inside.  I took a bite of my friend's Shaken Beef and it was equally comparable to my dish.  The beef was so tender that it melted in my mouth.  I dunked it in the lemon pepper dipping sauce which gave it a nice tang. 

I recommend also getting a side of garlic noodles to share.  If you love eggs, then you'll absolutely love these garlic noodles.  There are chunks of garlic and eggs goodness buttered all over each strand of noodle.  So yummy!

As if we didn't already stuff our faces enough, we were tempted by the dessert selection and ordered the Fried Bananas w/ Coconut Ice Cream.  No regrets there!  The warm, gooey texture of the bananas were so complimentary to the freshness of the coconut ice cream.  I didn't feel guilty at all polluting my body with the sugar since it was THAT good! 

It might sound like I work for Le Soleil or am a family member of the owners - BUT I am not :)  I am just a new crazed, avid fan!

excerpts:
Other suggestions would be the:
- BBQ pork spring rolls
- Garlic Noodles with crab, a classic!
bbq pork spring rolls.author: Nadine M.
bbq pork spring rolls.review:
I was excited to know that this place was going to open up again.  But, the way I found out about it was even more thrilling.  I got invited by my aunt, who's a good friend of the owner's, for a pre-opening family dinner!  The service was stellar, since we got the entire staff for ourselves!  We felt like kings and queens!  And the cuisine has gotten more refined since the remodeling.

My absolute favorite, which made me say "WOW!" from the first bite is:
- The "Quail Flambe with Rhum".  Absolutely outstanding in taste!
- The Chilean Sea Bass - this improved version which used to feature in their old menu is a must!
- Their Fish and Chips!  A true fusion dish between "East and West".  SO good and greasy!

Other suggestions would be the:
- BBQ pork spring rolls
- Garlic Noodles with crab, a classic!

A gem in the neighborhood!

excerpts: We got pho, Thai tea, and the pork and shrimp spring rolls for lunch
and it was so good!
Next time I'll try some of the more adventurous (French) soups.
They have a good variety of things I've haven't seen before.
It's a good French/Vietnamese combo without feeling too far from traditional Vietnamese food.
Really liked it!
pork and shrimp spring rolls.author: Kristan S.
pork and shrimp spring rolls.review: Friendly and warm service, good selection, and quality food! We got pho, Thai tea, and the pork and shrimp spring rolls for lunch and it was so good! Next time I'll try some of the more adventurous (French) soups. They have a good variety of things I've haven't seen before. It's a good French/Vietnamese combo without feeling too far from traditional Vietnamese food. Really liked it!

excerpts: We also ordered Pork and Shrimp Spring Rolls ($6) to share - and were presented with 6 little nubs.
I actually really did not like this dish because of the pork - super gamey!!!
pork and shrimp spring rolls.author: Eunice K.
pork and shrimp spring rolls.review:
Came here for lunch with a friend to satisfy a pho craving on a cold SF day! A cute little restaurant - decorated very upscale for the Inner Richmond area.

We came here specifically for the Chicken Pho ($9) - which my friend was raving about. I was skeptical having had "chicken pho" at other restaurants and they are always too bland! Not enough of the spices like regular pho! But this pho was actually very flavorful! My only complaint would be the small amount of chicken - felt they were a little skimpy!

We also ordered Pork and Shrimp Spring Rolls ($6) to share - and were presented with 6 little nubs. I actually really did not like this dish because of the pork - super gamey!!! Even the peanut sauce could not mask it!

I appreciated the fancy plates and decor - all for a very reasonably price. Their pho also tasted very "clean", the noodles were chewy, and they served pretty good portions! Just stay away from the pork spring rolls and you should be good!

excerpts: The coconut soup, garlic noodles, and pork and shrimp spring rolls were all mediocre.
There is better Vietnamese food nearby.
pork and shrimp spring rolls.author: Gabriel S.
pork and shrimp spring rolls.review: The coconut soup, garlic noodles, and pork and shrimp spring rolls were all mediocre. There is better Vietnamese food nearby.

excerpts: We love coming here with our friends so that we can try all their delicious dishes in one meal...from lollipop chickens to flaming quail to their infamous Dungeness crab garlic noodle.
quail.author: SC K.
quail.review:
Great Vietnamese Cuisine!!!  Such a neighborhood gem.  It's a Must-Try if you like Vietnamese food. 

We love coming here with our friends so that we can try all their delicious dishes in one meal...from lollipop chickens to flaming quail to their infamous Dungeness crab garlic noodle.  

Too bad we only had 2 people last night, but we did good - Beef Carpaccio, Lollipop Chicken, Calamari, Chicken & Shrimp Crepe, Garlic Noodle and "Shaken" Beef.  They were so good and service was great (we got seated by the window so we were able to "people watch" as well).

excerpts: The quail is to die for, the clay pot rice is also excellent.
quail.author: Vivien S.
quail.review: The hidden gem of all hidden gems. It's 11 mins of walk from the presidio golf so we came here after some practice at the driving range. The quail is to die for, the clay pot rice is also excellent.

excerpts: Sister told us about the quail that was on fire and we wanted to try it.
The food came out out pretty good.
Everything was really tasty and flavorful.
The service on the other hand was ehhh.
The staff that were working that night weren't really attentive..
their service wasn't horrible but we all felt a little ignored.. even when we were the biggest group at that time.
Will I go back?
Hmmmm

quail.review: Had family dinner here for hubby bday back in November. Sister told us about the quail that was on fire and we wanted to try it. The food came out out pretty good. Everything was really tasty and flavorful. The service on the other hand was ehhh. The staff that were working that night weren't really attentive.. their service wasn't horrible but we all felt a little ignored.. even when we were the biggest group at that time. Will I go back? Hmmmm

excerpts:
Our second app, flambé of quail, was nothing special though. 
For our entree, we had their special fried rice, deep fried sea bass with brussels sprouts  and boneless short rib.
I always order sea bass and have never had it with a crunch... 
Super good!
For dessert we had the fried banana with coconut ice cream.
All that plus two glasses of wine do two people - $105.
Before I end, I have to reiterate - excellent service!
quail.author: Cay A.
quail.review:
Excellent service and excellent food!
For starters, we totally enjoyed the duck spring rolls - very subtle flavor, but fresh.
Our second app, flambé of quail, was nothing special though. 
For our entree, we had their special fried rice, deep fried sea bass with brussels sprouts  and boneless short rib.
I always order sea bass and have never had it with a crunch... Super good!
For dessert we had the fried banana with coconut ice cream.
All that plus two glasses of wine do two people - $105.
Before I end, I have to reiterate - excellent service!

excerpts: For example, I ordered the quail, and when they presented it to our table, they ignited the quail in a big plume of blue flame, and it slowly crisped on the outside and was very tasty.
Their portions are fairly sized, and their food is overall decent.
quail.author: Mima G.
quail.review:
Have been a handful of times. Their presentation for some of the dishes was quite surprising. For example, I ordered the quail, and when they presented it to our table, they ignited the quail in a big plume of blue flame, and it slowly crisped on the outside and was very tasty. 
Their portions are fairly sized, and their food is overall decent.

excerpts: His specialties on the menu includes Flambéed Quail, Caramelized Sea Bass, and Roasted Garlic Dungeness Crab.
They also have brown rice.
quail.author: Cherylynn N.
quail.review:
Vietnamese food use to be a weekly staple for me. You could find me at Loi's, PPQ Noodle House, or Pho Huynh Hiep (Kevin's Noodle House) getting a nice facial over a hot steaming bowl of pho, face shoveling into a combo rice plate or getting buzzed off Vietnamese iced coffee. 

With age, came my intolerance to MSG and caffeine along with a couple of crow's feet, aching knees, and bladder leakage that will soon be in need of Depends. Not to mention passing out in front of the TV even before the guest list opens up at most clubs. Ohhh if only I can be 21 again. 

Anyhow, back to food talk because who doesn't love taking about food? :)

These days, I rarely if ever eat Vietnamese food because of the MSG. Yes, I know it's a staple in Asian cuisine but my body can no longer tolerate it so it makes it difficult to enjoy most Asian cuisine and the wallet-friendly prices. 

A rarity, Le Soleil serves upscale MSG-FREE Vietnamese cuisine with French influences. If you're looking for pho, please go somewhere else. It's ridiculous to complain that Le Soleil only has one pho option; they're not Pho 99. However, if you're looking to tantalize your taste buds with unique Vietnamese cuisine made with top-notch ingredients then Le Soleil is the place for you. 

The menu is fairly limited at just 22 items for dinner but with you can make special requests ahead of time with Chef Dennis (24-48 hour in advance so he can buy the ingredients) who's a super nice guy. His specialties on the menu includes Flambéed Quail, Caramelized Sea Bass, and Roasted Garlic Dungeness Crab. They also have brown rice. Yay!

We started with the Beef Carpaccio ($8). Sorry, no pic for this app since my phone decided to not share this deliciousness with you and deleted the pic *shakes fist*. The tender slices of filet mignon was lightly dressed in a citrus, mint, and chili concoction and served alongside a basket of freshly fried thick shrimp chips (not that stale, flimsy cheap shit at Chinese restaurants). A real solid starter. 

The Bo Luc Lac: Shaking Beef ($16) came next; spelled "shaken" on the menu. We added an egg on request (+$2) and it came on a sizzling platter which reminded me of Filipino sisig: http://bit.ly/186ePRX. Just when I thought I tasted the best bo luc lac at Bodega Bistro in TL, a bite of the mouth-wateringly buttery bo luc lac made me realized the BEST has been hidden here at Le Soleil. Not a dish I wanted to share, I'll tell you that much. 

All heads turned when the gargantuan Garlic Roasted Crab w/ Egg Noodles ($32) was placed on our table for two: http://bit.ly/18TBgMz. Insanely fresh, the crab was delicately tender and ohh sooo sweet. The bits of garlic infused just enough garlickyness without leaving us with major dragon breath. The innards of the crab was then mixed with the egg noodles for an artery-clogging carb fest. My only gripe was the noodles; it was more mushy and I like my noodles al-dente with a toothsome chew. Perhaps a thicker noodle would have fared better? 

I know people want to know if Le Soleil's crab is as good as PPQ or Thanh Long and there's really no comparison as both PPQ and Thanh Long uses tons of MSG to flavor their signature crab dishes. As I've said, that's like comparing real tits to fake ones. Don't get me wrong, I like fake ones too and I would get a pair to fix my lopsided ones but there's really no comparison.

Because it's not a complete dinner without dessert (especially when dining out), we wanted to order the Tempura Ice Cream but one of the waitresses brought us the Trio of Ice Cream. When we told her we had ordered the Tempura Ice Cream she said they didn't have it. We instead requested the Fried Bananas with Ice Cream ($4.50) which was tempura battered bananas served with coconut ice cream (sorry, no pic). Huh? They had the tempura batter for the bananas but not for the ice cream? This made no sense. 

Aside from this minor blunder, service was very friendly and attentive. A smile goes a long way which most Asian restaurants don't seem to get. But Le Soleil does. All smiles here--thank you!

Along with the atypical Vietnamese fare and good service, Le Soleil has a very contemporary and more upscale ambiance which makes it great for dates. Beware of the terrible parking situation in this area though. 

Everything about Le Soleil seems to warrant almost 5 stars. So why just 4? I asked if Chef Dennis can replicate Brodard's FAMOUS Nem Nuong Cuon in SoCal: http://bit.ly/1g5JNyD and he says he can with advanced notice. Going to hold out on that one extra star until I can meet my beloved crack rolls without travelling 400+ miles. If he can deliver, I will gladly upgrade to 5 stars with a big smooch on the face! I hope he doesn't mind sloppy seconds! I'm kidding....

excerpts: Quail 7 (flamed in rum and comes with lemon citrus dipping sauce) -
This is entertaining and delicious.
They light the quail in front of you and let the flames add the crunch to the skin.
quail.author: Sarah C.
quail.review:
My uncle took me here for dinner yesterday. When he picked me up he mentioned something about Vietnamese food. Sure why not. Showed up and it was totally not what I expected. Modern decor with dim lighting and spacious design. My uncle knew the owner and just let her decide what to make for us. 

Quail 7 (flamed in rum and comes with lemon citrus dipping sauce) - This is entertaining and delicious. They light the quail in front of you and let the flames add the crunch to the skin. It was pretty good. 

Lotus Root Salad 9 (protein, lotus root, carrots, shallots, basil, cucumber, and fresh fish sauce) - Usually comes with beef, but ours came with pork because my uncle is watching his health. This is probably my favorite dish. It was both hearthy and light/refreshing. 

Mango Sticky Rice 5.5 (fresh mangoes with sweet black sticky rice topped with warm coconut cream) - This was definitely unique. I never had a dessert like this before. 

We also had some off the menu stuff but its just a twist of what they have on their menu so same taste. 

Nice spacious and clean restrooms. One men and one women. 

Overall, it was a nice dining experience. Different. I really enjoy Asian fusion. 

Also the workers here are really nice.

excerpts: The quail set au flambé table side  was cool but forgettable and very small portioned.
I think you only get one tiny limp quail.
quail.author: Winnie L.
quail.review:
Good restaurant for modern Vietnamese fusion food with a nice setting. 

Imperial rolls were delicious but overpriced, garlic noodle crab was also delicious but I wouldn't say their garlic noodles are the traditional kind you find at PPQ. It's more of a soy sauce garlic fried noodle dish. Crab was succulent and tasty even though I'm quickly getting sick of crab. 

I came here for the carpaccio and it was well worth it. The quail set au flambé table side  was cool but forgettable and very small portioned. I think you only get one tiny limp quail.

Overall, it was good and I would return if I was in the area. 

Oh yeah, bathroom was nice. Big plus.

excerpts: We ordered: lollipop chicken, quail, laksa,  imperial roll and spicy chicken coconut soup.
The lollipop chicken had a tender juicy inside and the outside was crispy.
The quail had a sweet taste and was flambeed baked on your table.
The laksa had two jumbo shrimp with deep fried silky soft tofu, I loved the exceptional spicy flavor.
The imperial roll does not have your ordinary egg roll wrapping, this restaurant uses rice paper for the wrapping.
There was a lot of food on the menu that I wanted to try, such as dungeon crab with garlic noodle and sea bass.
The ambience is very comfortable and relaxing, and I would definitely come again when I am in town.
quail.author: Loretta L.
quail.review: I was in town visiting SF I ran in to a hidden Asian Fusion restaurant. I was stunned by the taste of the food. We ordered: lollipop chicken, quail, laksa,  imperial roll and spicy chicken coconut soup. The lollipop chicken had a tender juicy inside and the outside was crispy. The quail had a sweet taste and was flambeed baked on your table. The laksa had two jumbo shrimp with deep fried silky soft tofu, I loved the exceptional spicy flavor. The imperial roll does not have your ordinary egg roll wrapping, this restaurant uses rice paper for the wrapping. There was a lot of food on the menu that I wanted to try, such as dungeon crab with garlic noodle and sea bass. The ambience is very comfortable and relaxing, and I would definitely come again when I am in town.

excerpts: Flambe quail - this is actually one of their signature specials.
The quail arrives at the table with some sort of flammable alcohol on top, and the watistaff sets it on fire for a pyro show....but don't worry the bird is already marinated and dead
so it's not like Rage Against the Machine's first album cover, but is absolutely rockin'.
When the fire dies down the bird is at the right temperature to be consumed.
The flambé seals in the juices.

Now in terms of flavoring the quail has this remarkable cross between a sexcellent soy sauce chicken coupled with the complexity of Cantonese cha siu (bbq) marinade...maybe a tad Lee Kum Kee esque in flavoring.
It was like deja vu eating this.
$hit,
no wonder there were quite a number of Chinese customers in here.
quail.author: Ken K.
quail.review:
Those of you who have lived in the SF Bay Area and through the 1980s/90s will no doubt remember the famous Thanh Long restaurant (which spun its high end counterpart Crustacean) along with a few copycats or competitors offering somewhat similar fare. I cannot speak for Vietnamese expats and how they view this sort of fare, but they have taken some traditional and not so traditional receipes, and figured out a way to make the best use of local/American ingredients and made it into their signature dish (garlic butter roasted Dungeness crab). It's easy to say on one hand that it's Vietnamese style moo shoo poo poo doo doo...but it's not cheap for one thing!

Chinese American MSPPDD is cheap, and frankly even PF Chang's is not expensive like MY China or Koi Palace in comparison. The bottom line is, does it taste good, and what kind of clientele does it attract? WTF, did I just abbreviate moo shoo poo poo doo doo MSPPDD like Xiao long bao (XLB)??

With Le Soleil, while the style and approach can be argued to be similar to that of Thanh Long, there is a bit of a Chinese influence in a good number of the dishes. And that is because of the executive chef Dennis Wong, who is Vietnamese Chinese and who also understands the target demographic.

This restaurant continues to be very popular for a number of reasons. The food might not be authentic Vietnamese or regional specific by any means, but attracts a stready stream of clientele, mostly locals who live in the area (of which a majority are Cantonese speaking Chinese folks). 

With that said this meal was overall enjoyable.

Café sua da - eeeek no bueno. Crustacean and Thanh Long had a much better iced Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk in relation. This one had this whacked up Vanilla latte caramelly like flavor, like a really bad pre-made Lee's Sandwiches (McBanh Mi or Banh Bucks) iced milk coffee.

Young coconut - this was dessert. For those too lazy or don't have the hardware at home to cut it open. Drink the juice then use your ice cream scooping skills to carve out the coconut meat (delish).

Pan fried combination noodle - To be fair even a horrible chain (from the South and East Bay) New Tung Kee had something like this, but obviously this is way better. Vietnamese Chinese approach to HK style pan fried noodles (jeen meen), except the noodles were arranged like a "cake" format, with thicker layers that elevated the toppings (the stir fried combo of broccoli, chicken, shrimp etc). The sauce was a tad too sweet for my liking but otherwise seasoned well. Guessing the sugar is a bit of a crucial component to draw in the masses and is a bit of an unfortunate theme of a number of stir fry dishes here. So instead of asking to "hold the MSG, less salt, less oil" with here it's probably best to ask for "less sugar" in the dishes (unless sauces are pre-seasoned).

Flambe quail - this is actually one of their signature specials. The quail arrives at the table with some sort of flammable alcohol on top, and the watistaff sets it on fire for a pyro show....but don't worry the bird is already marinated and dead so it's not like Rage Against the Machine's first album cover, but is absolutely rockin'. When the fire dies down the bird is at the right temperature to be consumed. The flambé seals in the juices. Now in terms of flavoring the quail has this remarkable cross between a sexcellent soy sauce chicken coupled with the complexity of Cantonese cha siu (bbq) marinade...maybe a tad Lee Kum Kee esque in flavoring. It was like deja vu eating this. $hit, no wonder there were quite a number of Chinese customers in here. Although a tad sweet (my only gripe), this was very tasty.   

Stir fried Portobello mushrooms with Brussels sprouts and string beans - excellent stir fry with a good wok sear. Yet the theme of sugar is a touch strong here, although it provided the needed carmelization. If they could execute this similar to the sambal string beans at Shiok Singaporean Kitchen (more savory and umami), this would work even better.

Roasted crab with garlic noodles - ended up getting half crab, since there was already a lot of food. But those of you who love to whip out the cameras to let them eat first (before others) will know that excess is best...so therefore a whole crab over noodles will look a lot better than a few severed limbs (crab limbs that is). The noodles were like curly ramen....almost but not quite to the thinness of instant noodle ramen packets, yet were still quite tasty. Crab was not in season of course so not as fatty or juicy, but enjoyable.

It is said that the son (Walter Kwok) of one of the founders of Hong Kong commercial real estate conglomerate (Sun Hung Kei properties) dined here, and loved the food so much he was instrumental in helping Dennis open up Le Soleil at Royal Garden Tsim Sa Tsui in HK. Who are you to argue with the tastebuds of a multi zillionaire? If only I had a sponsor like that to write paid food reviews in HK  :-D

excerpts: Quail -- Mmmm.
The quail is already cooked when it arrives, but the waiter torches it at the table for good measure and good show.
The four of us shared one quail, which was sweet and tender to perfection.
quail.author: Laura C.
quail.review:
I found this place purely by using Yelp and I hope my review convinces you to come too. Le Soleil is a Vietnamese-French fusion restaurant that manages to be classy but not snobby. It's located in a quiet neighborhood in Richmond and the interior atmosphere is quite relaxing and modern as well. 

We arrived around 5:30 or 5:45 and the restaurant was almost empty. More people started coming in after 6:30 but it never felt crowded or noisy. Our waiters were very attentive in refilling our glasses (lemon- and apple-infused water) and changing our plates. But the food was the best part:

Beef Carpaccio -- Appetizer of thinly sliced rare filet mignon. It was my first time having raw beef and the meat melted in my mouth like fresh sashimi. Yum. The side notes of mint, onion, and roasted garlic were satisfying as well.

Green Papaya Salad -- This might have tasted better if it wasn't served right after the Beef Carpaccio, since it had the same mint-onion taste. The green papaya is in shreds and reminded me of turnip salad. It wasn't bad, but I don't think I'd order it again when I return (because I will return).

Quail -- Mmmm. The quail is already cooked when it arrives, but the waiter torches it at the table for good measure and good show. The four of us shared one quail, which was sweet and tender to perfection.

Caramelized Sea Bass -- Perhaps my perfect dish of the night. The texture and taste couldn't have been more satisfying and the brussel sprouts underneath were some of the yummiest I've had.

Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles -- I'm not a big fan of garlic noodles but these were delectable. I especially loved the crab, which was drizzled over with the contents of the crab shell (I'm Chinese and my family loves eating that). 

Turmeric Crepe -- I'm not a big fan of the fried taste so this wasn't my favorite dish, but it was also carefully prepared with carrots and greens on the side.

Tofu Eggplant -- Yummy, good with rice (rice texture was great too), and pretty reminiscent of Chinese food in flavor. 

My overall impression of Le Soleil was that each and every detail is carefully attended to. Not only was the food delicately prepared, but the bathroom was very clean and elegantly decorated, and the bill came in a bamboo cup instead of the usual tray or leather book. The meal was a little pricey, at $24 per person, but maybe that's just because we kept ordering more to try the menu. We got what we paid for, though. I'm so glad we live close to San Francisco because we are coming back here for sure.

excerpts: My other favorite dishes were the quail and the sea bass.
The service was very good, I like that they bring each dish at a time, not all together, so you can enjoy each of them.
The restaurant has a very relaxed atmosphere.
quail.author: Ana O.
quail.review:
My fiancé's parents took me to this restaurant because is one if their favorites in the city and I loved it. Everything I ate was delicious! I specially loved the garlic noodles with crab, it was so tasty and the crab perfectly cook. My other favorite dishes were the quail and the sea bass.
The service was very good, I like that they bring each dish at a time, not all together, so you can enjoy each of them.
 The restaurant has a very relaxed atmosphere.

excerpts: We had flaming quail, beef carpaccio, crab with garlic noodle, bun rieu, caramelized sea bass, and a new beef stew dish recommended by the owner.
For dessert, we had fried banana, and this dessert is a killer, complete our evening of wonderful food.
Servers are very tentative, and well trained.
The executive chef came out & checked on customers...that shows the caring for customers.
We will definitely come back to Le Soleil whenever we are in town.
quail.author: Vinh D.
quail.review: We were in SF with our friends, and we were craving for Vietnamese food. We found Le Soleil via Yelp so we gave it a try. It turned out to be a perfect choice...love the decor, very intimate ambiance, and most of all, their food. We had flaming quail, beef carpaccio, crab with garlic noodle, bun rieu, caramelized sea bass, and a new beef stew dish recommended by the owner. For dessert, we had fried banana, and this dessert is a killer, complete our evening of wonderful food. Servers are very tentative, and well trained. The executive chef came out & checked on customers...that shows the caring for customers. We will definitely come back to Le Soleil whenever we are in town.

excerpts: My friends love their Quail, she was scared when the waiter lights up the quail
but when she had her first bite, she was very surprised because it was so delicious.
quail.author: Tammy V.
quail.review:
I just simply love this place, the food, the decoration, and the excellent services. I am Vietnamese and my mom makes good Vietnamese food so I have lots of requests for viet food outside. Le Soleil really makes good food and mostly importantly, very reasonable price!!
I love the Imperial Roll,  Fried Chicken, Shaken Beef, Five Spice Chicken, and Garlic Noodles! Their chicken is very very juicy!! 
My friends love their Quail, she was scared when the waiter lights up the quail but when she had her first bite, she was very surprised because it was so delicious. 
The Mango sticky rice is a most try because they use black rice instead of the regular one. It's so good and their Creme Brulee is also very tasty! 
I really love this places!!

excerpts: We also ordered the Quail, which one of servers torched at the table.
quail.author: Monica H.
quail.review:
Delicious food and friendly service! 

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Saturday night. The server took her time to explain the menu and recommended Chicken Lollipops, the Curry Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles with Prawns. We also ordered the Quail, which one of servers torched at the table. Cool presentation! 

Everything was fantastic, especially the Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles. I definitely recommend coming here.

excerpts:
Ambiance: complete remodel, very comfortable feel, great date place
Food: Vietnamese cuisine, excellent variety, every item on the menu is tasty especially the crab and my favorite quail.
Bevs: Water is memorable!
Excellent wine list

Price: Very reasonable, nice happy hour menu
Service:
Terrific, attentive,
Overall: Highly recommended, one of the top restaurants on Clement
quail.author: Carlos S.
quail.review:
Ambiance: complete remodel, very comfortable feel, great date place
Food: Vietnamese cuisine, excellent variety, every item on the menu is tasty especially the crab and my favorite quail.
Bevs: Water is memorable! Excellent wine list
Price: Very reasonable, nice happy hour menu
Service: Terrific, attentive,
Overall: Highly recommended, one of the top restaurants on Clement

excerpts: Go for the quail.
You won't regret it.
It's set in white rum and finished table side.
Meaning the waitress sets the quail on fire in front of you.
quail.author: Jenny L.
quail.review:
01.12.10

This restaurant is not equipped for loud people.  We were placed in the corner window table, so we disturbed the other patrons the least.  At least that's how I felt.  If only we could stop giggling about nothing.

Their beers come cold with a frosted mug.  I love that.

Go for the quail.  You won't regret it.  It's set in white rum and finished table side.  Meaning the waitress sets the quail on fire in front of you.  Awesome.

Garlic noodle with prawns plus garlic beef are both fantastic.  Portions are bigger than I remembered.  Big plus since I'm eating the leftovers as I finish this review.

excerpts: We ordered the green papaya salad and the quail as the appetizers, the dungeness crab with noodles as the main course, and the mango sticky rice as the dessert.
The salad was decent.
The crab was very not meaty and the noodles that comes with the course is fairly salty for my taste.
And lastly the dessert was okay
, the mango wasn't sour but wasn't sweet either.
And for this quality of the food, I thought the price was fairly expensive.
The crab dish alone was already ~$46.
I much prefer the crab restaurant a few blocks away.
quail.author: Johnston C.
quail.review: I came here for dinner for two in January.  I thought the service was good, but the food was only so so.  We ordered the green papaya salad and the quail as the appetizers, the dungeness crab with noodles as the main course, and the mango sticky rice as the dessert.  The salad was decent.  The crab was very not meaty and the noodles that comes with the course is fairly salty for my taste.  And lastly the dessert was okay, the mango wasn't sour but wasn't sweet either.  And for this quality of the food, I thought the price was fairly expensive.  The crab dish alone was already ~$46.  I much prefer the crab restaurant a few blocks away.

excerpts: I remember having the spring rolls, quail, shaking beef and the yummy yummy crab and garlic noodles.
As I am typing I am probably due for another trip here soon!
How can I forget to add that the staff here is amazing....
thanks Le Soleil!
quail.author: Allison T.
quail.review: How did I not know about this little gem in the inner Richmond! I had my bday dinner #6 here and what a memorable dinner I had here. Good wine selection and yummy delish food. We did order a lot so let me try to list everything.  I remember having the spring rolls, quail, shaking beef and the yummy yummy crab and garlic noodles.  As I am typing I am probably due for another trip here soon!  How can I forget to add that the staff here is amazing....thanks Le Soleil!

excerpts: The quail appetizer was delicious.
My favorite dish I would have to say was the "Shaken Beef
" I recommend this plate to anybody that likes meat.
The lemon sauce OMG the best thing ever, make sure you dip it in that.
The service was great.
The waiters always checking up on me, making sure
I was okay with my order and everything and always refilling my water.
They were so nice and thoughtful.
I can't wait to go back!!
quail.author: William D.
quail.review: The food was amazing. I took my mom here for her birthday and it was just the best thing ever. I ordered Chicken Lollipops, my goodness taste like heaven The quail appetizer was delicious. My favorite dish I would have to say was the "Shaken Beef" I recommend this plate to anybody that likes meat. The lemon sauce OMG the best thing ever, make sure you dip it in that. The service was great. The waiters always checking up on me, making sure I was okay with my order and everything and always refilling my water. They were so nice and thoughtful. I can't wait to go back!!

excerpts: We had a bunch of dishes including the fun Quail appetizer that get's "flamed" at your table.
Very tasty, but of course not a lot of meat on those quail bones.
quail.author: Natalie W.
quail.review:
Wonderful food and great service!  We had a bunch of dishes including the fun Quail appetizer that get's "flamed" at your table. Very tasty, but of course not a lot of meat on those quail bones. 

Loved the Caramelized Sea Bass and had the Short Ribs too. The service was very good and we went on a Saturday night. The owner stopped by and talked to us for at least 15 minutes. This is a good neighborhood find!  I'm going back again that's for sure. ;-)

excerpts:
My absolute favorite, which made me say "WOW!" from the first bite is:
- The "Quail Flambe with Rhum".  
Absolutely outstanding in taste!
- The Chilean Sea Bass - this improved version which used to feature in their old menu is a must!
quail.author: Nadine M.
quail.review:
I was excited to know that this place was going to open up again.  But, the way I found out about it was even more thrilling.  I got invited by my aunt, who's a good friend of the owner's, for a pre-opening family dinner!  The service was stellar, since we got the entire staff for ourselves!  We felt like kings and queens!  And the cuisine has gotten more refined since the remodeling.

My absolute favorite, which made me say "WOW!" from the first bite is:
- The "Quail Flambe with Rhum".  Absolutely outstanding in taste!
- The Chilean Sea Bass - this improved version which used to feature in their old menu is a must!
- Their Fish and Chips!  A true fusion dish between "East and West".  SO good and greasy!

Other suggestions would be the:
- BBQ pork spring rolls
- Garlic Noodles with crab, a classic!

A gem in the neighborhood!

excerpts:
My favorites are:

- Garlic noodle with Crab
- Luc Lac Shaken Beef
- House Fried Rice
- Beef Carpaccio
- Flambeed Quail 
- Imperial and Spring rolls
- Soy glazed Seabass

And don't forget the desserts!
quail.author: Karen L.
quail.review:
Absolutely delicious!  Thinking about their menu now is making me drool. 

My favorites are:

- Garlic noodle with Crab
- Luc Lac Shaken Beef
- House Fried Rice
- Beef Carpaccio
- Flambeed Quail 
- Imperial and Spring rolls
- Soy glazed Seabass

And don't forget the desserts! Fried coconut ice cream, sticky rice with mango...YUM!

excerpts: Best things to order: shrimp chips ($2 during happy hour!), quail which is flambed tableside, the shaken beef, and the caramelized sea bass.
The sea bass had a delicious soy glazed crust which was perfect.
A lot of the lower ratings for this place came before it was remodeled and reopened.
The food was amazing!
quail.author: Lauren C.
quail.review: Best things to order: shrimp chips ($2 during happy hour!), quail which is flambed tableside, the shaken beef, and the caramelized sea bass. The sea bass had a delicious soy glazed crust which was perfect. A lot of the lower ratings for this place came before it was remodeled and reopened. The food was amazing!

excerpts: very homey..you have to try their flambed quail....with a yummy lemony sauce...
it is a bit sour
so if you enjoy sour like i do, then u would really like it
...also you have to get their veggie spring rolls...
it comes with a spicy sweet sauce...
then save room for their peppery crab and garlic noodles....

their crab is prepared very uniquely...as it is done with egg...the pieces of scrambled egg is perfect if you mix with the noodles or just a bowl of rice will do....hopefully your mouth is starting to water so hurry over there and don't forget to order a glass of ice coffee or tea with ur meal...
it is just the perfect combo..
quail.author: Mee-stique K.
quail.review: WOW....what a gr8 restaurant this is....for you who are looking for delicious vietnamese food...you gotta visit this place...they recently renovated the whole restaurant.....very homey..you have to try their flambed quail....with a yummy lemony sauce...it is a bit sour so if you enjoy sour like i do, then u would really like it...also you have to get their veggie spring rolls...it comes with a spicy sweet sauce...then save room for their peppery crab and garlic noodles....their crab is prepared very uniquely...as it is done with egg...the pieces of scrambled egg is perfect if you mix with the noodles or just a bowl of rice will do....hopefully your mouth is starting to water so hurry over there and don't forget to order a glass of ice coffee or tea with ur meal...it is just the perfect combo..

excerpts: We ordered: lollipop chicken, quail, laksa,  imperial roll and spicy chicken coconut soup.
The lollipop chicken had a tender juicy inside and the outside was crispy.
The quail had a sweet taste and was flambeed baked on your table.
The laksa had two jumbo shrimp with deep fried silky soft tofu, I loved the exceptional spicy flavor.
The imperial roll does not have your ordinary egg roll wrapping, this restaurant uses rice paper for the wrapping.
There was a lot of food on the menu that I wanted to try, such as dungeon crab with garlic noodle and sea bass.
The ambience is very comfortable and relaxing, and I would definitely come again when I am in town.
spicy chicken coconut soup.author: Loretta L.
spicy chicken coconut soup.review: I was in town visiting SF I ran in to a hidden Asian Fusion restaurant. I was stunned by the taste of the food. We ordered: lollipop chicken, quail, laksa,  imperial roll and spicy chicken coconut soup. The lollipop chicken had a tender juicy inside and the outside was crispy. The quail had a sweet taste and was flambeed baked on your table. The laksa had two jumbo shrimp with deep fried silky soft tofu, I loved the exceptional spicy flavor. The imperial roll does not have your ordinary egg roll wrapping, this restaurant uses rice paper for the wrapping. There was a lot of food on the menu that I wanted to try, such as dungeon crab with garlic noodle and sea bass. The ambience is very comfortable and relaxing, and I would definitely come again when I am in town.

excerpts: The lotus root salad and green papaya salad were good, but tasted similar.
I liked the duck rolls, calamari, beef carpaccio, and would have ordered seconds if we didn't have all the other dishes.
Lollipop chicken and shrimp krispies were decent for deep fried food lovers.
Garlic noodles and crab fried rice were just enough for side dishes.
lotus root salad.author: Angelia H.
lotus root salad.review:
Ambience is nice, service is good. Overall, I felt the appetizers were better tasting than the main dishes. 
The lotus root salad and green papaya salad were good, but tasted similar. I liked the duck rolls, calamari, beef carpaccio, and would have ordered seconds if we didn't have all the other dishes. Lollipop chicken and shrimp krispies were decent for deep fried food lovers. Garlic noodles and crab fried rice were just enough for side dishes. Thumbs up on oxtail soup, eggplant & tofu, and portobello mushroom. The lamb chops weren't my favorite. The shaken beef was tender.

excerpts: Lotus Root Salad (5):
The appearance of this thing was interesting.
After the first bite though, flavors and textures just exploded!
If nothing else than to get that lotus root salad and the young coconut.
Super good!
lotus root salad.author: Jeremy L.
lotus root salad.review:
The lobster was amazing!  

Had to special order it in advance cause they go out and purchase a 3 pound lobster just for you!  They said thats the only way chef likes to make it so its not on the menu.  It was amazing though!  Served on a bed of fried rice which was big enough to feed the table.  Everything else that we got on the menu was also amazing!

Lotus Root Salad (5): The appearance of this thing was interesting.  After the first bite though, flavors and textures just exploded!  Just a great combination with bits of beef to contrast the light, sweet, and tangy salad flavors.   

Caramelized Sea Bass (5): As expected, light and melts in your mouth.  Excellent!

Luc Lac Shaken Beef (5): Tender, juicy cubes of beef served with a sort of tangy sauce that contrasts the salty meat well. 

Fried Banana with Coconut Ice Cream (4): Lightly fried bananas with some smooth coconut ice cream.  Simple yet delicious.  

Young Coconut (5): I hesitated on this one.  Just thought it'd be a cut open coconut that you can drink the water from.  Did not expect how amazing this coconut water was!  It was sweeter than expected and had a very refreshing flavor to it.  The coconut meat was also super soft and sweet!  Almost like eating a healthy and natural almond jello.  I'd eat this every day if I could.  

Everything was pretty solid and amazing on this visit.  The food was on point.  The chef even came out and asked us if everything was good and up to our standards (probably cause we special ordered the lobster).  Overall, amazing experience.  Will likely return when we're in the area.  If nothing else than to get that lotus root salad and the young coconut.  Super good!

excerpts: Lotus Root Salad 9 (protein, lotus root, carrots, shallots, basil, cucumber, and fresh fish sauce) - Usually comes with beef, but ours came with pork because my uncle is watching his health.
This is probably my favorite dish.
lotus root salad.author: Sarah C.
lotus root salad.review:
My uncle took me here for dinner yesterday. When he picked me up he mentioned something about Vietnamese food. Sure why not. Showed up and it was totally not what I expected. Modern decor with dim lighting and spacious design. My uncle knew the owner and just let her decide what to make for us. 

Quail 7 (flamed in rum and comes with lemon citrus dipping sauce) - This is entertaining and delicious. They light the quail in front of you and let the flames add the crunch to the skin. It was pretty good. 

Lotus Root Salad 9 (protein, lotus root, carrots, shallots, basil, cucumber, and fresh fish sauce) - Usually comes with beef, but ours came with pork because my uncle is watching his health. This is probably my favorite dish. It was both hearthy and light/refreshing. 

Mango Sticky Rice 5.5 (fresh mangoes with sweet black sticky rice topped with warm coconut cream) - This was definitely unique. I never had a dessert like this before. 

We also had some off the menu stuff but its just a twist of what they have on their menu so same taste. 

Nice spacious and clean restrooms. One men and one women. 

Overall, it was a nice dining experience. Different. I really enjoy Asian fusion. 

Also the workers here are really nice.

excerpts: A close second to the lotus root salad.
Extremely tasty and loved how there were chunks of crab in the garlic noodles themselves.
Ugh.
Drooling just thinking about it as I write this review.
Compared to PPQ Dungeness Crab, I think the noodles here are wayyy better.
Also, you can get the crab half or whole - we got half (3 people, but we also ordered other stuff).
The reason for the 0.5 points docked off was that the crab portion was way smaller than I had expected.
Or maybe I just eat a lot?
Noted: I'll get (at least) a whole crab next time.
lotus root salad.author: Lena R.
lotus root salad.review:
Le Soleil is located right next to B Star, which often gets more of the hype given the Burmese food craze. Do not let that fool you. This is truly a hidden gem!

We came here on a Thursday evening at around 615pm with no wait time. We ordered the following:

-Lotus Root Salad: 5/5 OMG, please do me a favor and order this. It's baby lotus root shoots (not like the huge Chinese purpley kind) with super flavorful and tender marinated beef and bean sprouts. The showstopper of the entire night IMO. My close friends all know I don't like eating salad, so if I'm raving about the salad, just get it.

-Garlic Dungeness crab with garlic noodles: 4.5/5
A close second to the lotus root salad. Extremely tasty and loved how there were chunks of crab in the garlic noodles themselves. Ugh. Drooling just thinking about it as I write this review. Compared to PPQ Dungeness Crab, I think the noodles here are wayyy better. Also, you can get the crab half or whole - we got half (3 people, but we also ordered other stuff). The reason for the 0.5 points docked off was that the crab portion was way smaller than I had expected. Or maybe I just eat a lot? Noted: I'll get (at least) a whole crab next time. Anyways...

-Duck roasted house special fried rice: 4/5 so addicting, with large pieces of roast duck and pineapple in the rice. The reason for the -1 pt: don't get me wrong, this was super super super tasty, and maybe my food standards are way too high, but it wasn't mind blowing. Don't let my comment fool you though, it was still extremely tasty and would order again.

-Sizzling seafood: 3.5/5 large portions of fish and big prawns. My issue with the dish was that the calamari was definitely on the rubbery side. Otherwise, the rest of the seafood was overall solid. 

-Mango with black sticky rice and coconut cream: 4/5 I love Asian desserts and this is no exception. The coconut cream and sticky rice were executed to a perfect consistency: light, flavorful, chewy but not soggy. 

***TIP: this place also surprisingly has really good teas. If you like fragrant teas, try the Blooming Tea next time.

excerpts:
We had:

Lotus Root Salad =)
Beef Carpaccio, can't get enough of it all over the crispy chip...
lotus root salad.author: Vee V.
lotus root salad.review:
4.5 stars...until i try their crab (they were out the other night)

This place is right across from Chapeau on Clement Street. I wanted to try it months ago but never had a chance to. 
What a fantastic place, I love everything on their menu. We had:

Lotus Root Salad =)
Beef Carpaccio, can't get enough of it all over the crispy chip...
Grilled Chicken (perfectly crispy)
BBQ Pork Spring rolls (YUUUUUM)
SeaBass....my mouth is watering just typing it out...
Garlic noodle (not the usual greasy kind...it's got more texture...)
Shaken Beef
Washed it all down with Coconut Juice...

I absolutely luv vietnamese cuisine and Le Soleil def delivered, above n beyond my expectation. Really like the simple yet elegant decor...and all the abacus on the wall!

MUST TRY!

excerpts: The lotus root salad is also a MUST get!
lotus root salad.author: Lily N.
lotus root salad.review:
We tried the soft shelled crab, which was really good and perfectly fried!  Had a nice lemony sauce that nicey complimented this cute dish.
