Great place, bit pricey more usual than average (about 18-20 per dish depending on what you get) as the prices rose, but do try the curry short ribs. Its a weird in a good way mix of crunchy and tenderness.
All their dishes are pretty good so try those too.

But try the curry short ribs first

excerpts: The beef curry short ribs had a great flavor and a good deep fried coating, which really hooked me at first, but they're fried to hell and swimming in creamy, greasy sauce.
After a couple pieces I couldn't stomach any more.
The lamb chops came with two pieces -- one overcooked, the other almost raw, sitting on what could only be described as gritty, sticky purple peanut butter without taste.
curry short ribs.author: Laura W.
curry short ribs.review:
PROS -
The pumpkin ice cream dessert was tasty. The owner was nice for showing concern and comping one of our dishes, and sending over the free dessert.

CONS - I. can't. even.
The service was, honestly, the worst ever. More on that in a sec.

Appetizers: The imperial rolls were pretty standard, but good and crispy. The soft shell crab was salty, fishy and mushy -- but the shell wasn't even soft enough. The batter was tasty but sooo greasy.

Entrees: The beef curry short ribs had a great flavor and a good deep fried coating, which really hooked me at first, but they're fried to hell and swimming in creamy, greasy sauce. After a couple pieces I couldn't stomach any more. The lamb chops came with two pieces -- one overcooked, the other almost raw, sitting on what could only be described as gritty, sticky purple peanut butter without taste. Along with bitter, tough Brussels sprouts that were *actually* the least awful part of the dish.

Service: where do I even start....

The waiter who asked at the door whether we had a reservation (we did.) said we'd have to wait at least 10 minutes until more tables cleared. (Even though we saw an empty, clean table right there.) After several minutes waiting in the entryway, suddenly the owner noticed us and sat us right away, at that table.

It was a wait before anyone came to take our order... when the waitress finally came over, they were out of the appetizer we wanted (we saw other tables getting it before us). Instead of giving us a second to pick another she said "Sorry we're out of that, I'll come back later" and left.

She came back with our drinks awhile later. My bf's beer was in a bottle with some poured into the glass -- one inch of liquid in the bottom of the glass, about 5 inches of foam. We both laughed because it honestly looked like a joke. My wine was a white (not what I expected or wanted) so she went back to check if it was the one I'd asked for. She returned, and yes -- apparently I'd ordered the only white on the red side of the wine list. She was nice enough to offer a new glass no questions asked, I thanked her and said we're ready to order, too, she just dashed away with the unwanted wine saying "okay I'll come back later." bluuurrrgggghhhhhhh

We FINALLY order and get our dishes (see rant above) and were not impressed. The owner walked by and noticed our lamb dish was hardly touched and was bright bloody pink. She was so nice, apologized and offered to cook it more or bring us something new -- however we were pretty put off and said we were full anyway. She took it off the bill. I really appreciate that she cared so much and tried to make it a better experience.

So we were done eating, and a different waiter came to clear our plates. We had one short rib left, and even though he didn't love the dish, my bf asked for a box to take it home. The waiter says ok, then forgets and immediately throws a dirty bowl right into the dish. He heard my "Uh?!" as he ran off, and rushed back to apologize and tried to take the bowl out of the dish and sort of held it out as if we might still want it. OMG NO!!!!!!!!!!

Hence the free dessert. The owner was so apologetic and it's not like we were even complaining -- it's just that the experience was so clearly terrible from beginning to end. Because of the owner's obvious concern and kindness, I raised my star rating from 1 stars to 2. Unfortunately I just can't rate the place any higher no matter how good her intentions are.

This place could use an ENTIRELY new waitstaff, a better wine list that makes sense on the menu, a few fresh dishes that aren't so greasy, more consistent chefs -- just change everything please.

excerpts: Then, Wendy's boyfriend, Jerry, ordered the Curry Short Ribs and I ordered the Shaken Beef for entrees and we shared.
The Curry Short Ribs was very unique - the short ribs were served in a clay pot with the curry, but seemed to have been fried first as it was crispy.
It was a good dish.
The Shaken Beef is a classic, but done SO well here
- it was super tender and flavorful.
curry short ribs.author: Tiffie L.
curry short ribs.review:
DELISH. My friend, Wendy, introduced me to this place this week. What a GREAT restaurant. It's not straight up Vietnamese food, but more of French-Vietnamese fusion. 

The restaurant is small, but holds quite a few people. As the night wore on, I was surprised at how packed it got on a weeknight! The service was generally good and friendly. The restaurant felt intimate and had pretty decor. 

I let Wendy recommend the food since she had been here often. Everything was AMAZING. We had the Beef Carpaccio (SOOOO good and served on top of homemade shrimp crackers) and Shrimp Papaya Salad (light and refreshing, not too spicy!) for appetizers. 

Then, Wendy's boyfriend, Jerry, ordered the Curry Short Ribs and I ordered the Shaken Beef for entrees and we shared. The Curry Short Ribs was very unique - the short ribs were served in a clay pot with the curry, but seemed to have been fried first as it was crispy. It was a good dish. The Shaken Beef is a classic, but done SO well here - it was super tender and flavorful. I would probably order this every time... 

We ended the night with Tempura Ice Cream. The tempura batter was a thin coat and perfectly fried so that the ice cream was still nice and firm on the inside. It was also just really yummy, creamy ice cream. A great finish to a great meal!

excerpts: I would definitely recommend you order the five spice chicken and curry short ribs!
curry short ribs.author: Amanda H.
curry short ribs.review: This has become a usual dinner place for my boyfriend and I. We love this place so much for its delicious food, ambiance, and amazing service. I would definitely recommend you order the five spice chicken and curry short ribs!

excerpts:
Garlic noodles - ok
Shaking beef - gooooood
Curry short ribs - gooooood
Sea bass - really goooooood
Coconut chicken soup - really gooooood.
curry short ribs.author: Denise M.
curry short ribs.review:
Garlic noodles - ok
Shaking beef - gooooood
Curry short ribs - gooooood
Sea bass - really goooooood
Coconut chicken soup - really gooooood.

Fried banana - good, but typical.
Tempura ice cream - meh
Sundae - excellent 

Great and friendly service. 
Dungeoness crab noodles looked amazing.  Will have to try when we go back.

Not good for children, as the main Yelp page says it is, which is why we went there.  Yes, we do check.  For the first time ever, my son decided that he was going to scream bloody murder - so we took him outside.  Very embarrassing, but thank you to all the patient and understanding patrons we apologized profusely to that night.  The staff was also very accommodating with my toddler.

excerpts: The Curry Short Ribs were cooked to perfection.
The flavor was so good and it melted in your mouth.
The Shaken Beef Dish was also very good.
It had a side sauce made of lemons and spices in which you could dip the dish into and it just made everything so mouth watering.
curry short ribs.author: Jeremy C.
curry short ribs.review:
Came in for my 1 year anniversary and man, this place really surpassed my expectations.  Asked for the best table, got one right next to the window. 

Service was excellent, not only was our server attentive, the rest of the workers came by and checked up on us.  The OWNER himself even came out to greet us and have a chat.

FOOD WAS DELISHIOSO MUCHO.  My goodness their Beef Carpaccio was on the spot.  The Curry Short Ribs were cooked to perfection.  The flavor was so good and it melted in your mouth.  The Shaken Beef Dish was also very good.  It had a side sauce made of lemons and spices in which you could dip the dish into and it just made everything so mouth watering.  The Coconut Drink we ordered actually came from a COCONUT!

5 Stars all the way, GREAT DINING EXPERIENCE

excerpts: The Curry Short Ribs was amazing and leaves a lasting impression in your mouth.
The short ribs were battered and crispy and it works really with the curry.
The only issue I had with it was the fat on it.
curry short ribs.author: Jimmy N.
curry short ribs.review:
This place is bomb af. Decent price for delicious food. It's a casual restaurant so of course I was expecting loud noises and lots of talking. But, the place is really modern and decorated incredibly well. Really nice ambience and I get a somewhat intimate vibe.

I recommend the Shaken Beef, it's so juicy and cooked to perfection. The Curry Short Ribs was amazing and leaves a lasting impression in your mouth. The short ribs were battered and crispy and it works really with the curry. The only issue I had with it was the fat on it. If they trimmed some of it off, it'd be perfect.

Definitely a must try!

excerpts: The server took her time to explain the menu and recommended Chicken Lollipops, the Curry Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles with Prawns.
curry short ribs.author: Monica H.
curry short ribs.review:
Delicious food and friendly service! 

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Saturday night. The server took her time to explain the menu and recommended Chicken Lollipops, the Curry Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles with Prawns. We also ordered the Quail, which one of servers torched at the table. Cool presentation! 

Everything was fantastic, especially the Short Ribs and Garlic Noodles. I definitely recommend coming here.

excerpts: The curry short ribs are the best...and taste even better the next day.
You can't go wrong with the shaking beef or the lamb chops either.
Have to try the lunch menu next time...
the escargot soup sounds awesome!
curry short ribs.author: Cindy T.
curry short ribs.review: The new dinner menu has more of Chef Wong's specialties and unique dishes. The curry short ribs are the best...and taste even better the next day. You can't go wrong with the shaking beef or the lamb chops either. Have to try the lunch menu next time...the escargot soup sounds awesome!

excerpts: Curry short ribs (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=8k-5WXGICzItTzseiSE3Tg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Tender and boneless, these were easy to eat and paired well with either the garlic noodles or the claypot rice.
Claypot rice (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cTbzYy1pdlt9zGrHMaTM3A&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q)
- There is certainly no shortage of ingredients in this dish as shown in the picture.
claypot rice.author: Mike C.
claypot rice.review:
The beauty of San Francisco is the variety of cuisines available in a 7 x 7 mile radius.  Not only merely by countries or nations, you can find various regional cooking styles whether north, south, east, or west.  With Vietnamese cuisine, the south and north areas specialize in different signature dishes.

My friends who hosted this meal picked this neighborhood gem for a recent weeknight supper.  Being my first time, I deferred to them in composing our meal.  The dining room was about half full as we were seated at a wall table on the left.  Our party of four fit comfortably here but, after our order was placed, the table seemed small given the food that was to come.

Here's what we shared family style:

Appetizers
1.  Green papaya shrimp salad (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=W3bk1ovEVEhuuM2mhAb6ig&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Refreshing and clean, this was a perfect palate opener.  Love the tangy and sweet fish sauce dressing.

2.  Imperial rolls (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=0mLUIvtX3JTJsH8VICstmg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Always appreciate chefs who stay true to the cuisine, using the proper wrapper (not Chinese spring roll) to make this.  Always a table favorite.

3.  Crispy calamari (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=E1hfdF_pLCiOBeOfVhyXoA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - A non conventional take on fried calamari as this is seasoned with Thai chili sauce and other herbs.  Nice flavor contrast to the first two apps.

Mains
4.  Curry short ribs (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=8k-5WXGICzItTzseiSE3Tg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Tender and boneless, these were easy to eat and paired well with either the garlic noodles or the claypot rice.  The sauce was rich but note overly so.

5.  Garlic roasted Dungeness crab, whole (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Hb0KDx8ghfUY8J5WzizUmw&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Served with garlic noodles, this crab was a solid dish.  The flavors weren't particularly distinct but you can't beat eating fresh crab when in season.  Be ready to lick those fingers.

6.  Caramelized sea bass (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=fl0s19_lcgnZksbPO0RhDA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Not my favorite but another decent dish.  Don't get me wrong, the fish was fine and paired well with the broccoli but it didn't particularly wow me.

7.  Claypot rice (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cTbzYy1pdlt9zGrHMaTM3A&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - There is certainly no shortage of ingredients in this dish as shown in the picture.  Just wished the rice was a tad more crispy for that clay pot effect.

By the time we finished our meal, the dining room was just about full, seemingly with mostly neighborhood locals.  We asked our waiter to pack the leftovers and, after our gracious hosts paid the bill, tried to walk off dinner along Clement Street.

The food ranks four plus with an extra half star for the efficient service (rounding up to five).

excerpts: Claypot rice - 7 of 10, tastes great with the hot sauce provided.
Seemed like a small portion, but I eat a lot
claypot rice.author: Alice E.
claypot rice.review:
Haven't been here in a LONG time, came in for a plesant lunch with my husband.  

Ordered: Bun Xeo - 7 of 10, was nice and crunchy with a lot of veggies, but I wasn't fond of the coconut flavor.  Thats just my personal choice.  My mom never made it that way, maybe cuz she was lazy?

Claypot rice - 7 of 10, tastes great with the hot sauce provided.  Seemed like a small portion, but I eat a lot so maybe it was me?

Bun Bo Lac (shaking beef)  - EH.  I'd say 5 of 10.  Not much to write about. 

Customer service was great, very attentive.  Will be back for more num num.

excerpts: Overall, definitely not the typical "authentic" Vietnamese place with $10 pho and vermicelli bowls but for the taste and ambiance
, I'm a fan.
Still kinda surprised at the lack of customers though... almost made me suspicious.
vermicelli.author: Lucy Z.
vermicelli.review:
The whole restaurant was empty except for us... for two hours... on a Wednesday night. Based on the reviews, that was definitely a surprise. Almost felt kinda bad for them :/

We ordered:
- fried rice (with duck!): the duck pieces were small but overall it was a pretty tame dish but generous serving size.
- curry short ribs: really flavorful curry and the meat was extremely tender. Waitress suggested that we get the garlic bread to dip the curry in. It was fine but not necessary. The combination was kinda interesting and I think white rice would have been fine. Serving was also slightly more generous than I expected. 

Overall, definitely not the typical "authentic" Vietnamese place with $10 pho and vermicelli bowls but for the taste and ambiance, I'm a fan. Still kinda surprised at the lack of customers though... almost made me suspicious.

excerpts: hubby ordered the lemongrass beef special ($13), which came with bbq beef, pickled carrot, mint, bean sprouts, lettuce and chili over a bed of vermicelli noodles.
vermicelli.author: Ellen L.
vermicelli.review:
very nice restaurant for a group setting!  my friends and i, a party of 12, needed a place for a casual lunch, and one of the gals suggested this restaurant in the heart of inner richmond.  this was a GOOD choice b/c we were able to reserve ahead of time and they had a larger, corner table in the back which was perfect for our group, which included 4 babies/toddlers.

we arrived on a sunday afternoon, around 14.00, and the restaurant was fairly full, but not so full that we had a delay in service.  they had many lunch specials, as well as items to order a la carte.

hubby and i ordered the vegetarian spring rolls ($7) to share...these were rolls of mushroom, cabbage, carrot, celery wrapped inside thin rice paper, cut into 8 bite size pieces.  they came with a small side of sweet soy sauce which made for a tasty appetizer, and great start to our meal.

hubby ordered the lemongrass beef special ($13), which came with bbq beef, pickled carrot, mint, bean sprouts, lettuce and chili over a bed of vermicelli noodles.  he thought this was a tasty lunch plate, with great flavors, but he wasn't quite full after finishing his meal.

i ordered the tofu claypot ($12) which was a hot pot of fresh and fried tofu, mixed with assorted mushrooms, onions, and a bit of thai chili.  for a cool day, this was the perfect dish to order to satisfy my stomach.  i wasn't a fan of the fried tofu, but i loved the slightly silken texture of the fresh tofu and mushrooms.  the broth was amazing, not too salty, with a great blend of asian herbs.

service was quite prompt as we didn't have to wait long to order or have food prepared or receive the bill.  our water glasses were filled without us asking.

there was a single women's restroom, and single men's room in the rear, so i actually had to wait a bit, but it wasn't too bad...least the restrooms were kept clean!

parking was a bit of a challenge, esp since there was a farmer's market right outside the restaurant on sunday, but we lucked out and found something about 3 blocks away.

pretty good restaurant with delicious food and reasonable prices, esp for san francisco!

excerpts: The warm Imperial Rolls served with fresh mint, lettuce, vermicelli and pickled veggie was HEALTHY and TASTY!
vermicelli.author: Lis A.
vermicelli.review:
Le Soleil is a gem find! It doesn't look like a Vietnamese restaurant on first look but offers authentic Vietnamese food. A good friend who is selective about food brought me here and I was a happy camper savoring every delectable dish.

The Chicken & Shrimp Crepe was DYNAMITE with coconut egg crepe filled with chicken, shrimp and bean sprouts! The warm Imperial Rolls served with fresh mint, lettuce, vermicelli and pickled veggie was HEALTHY and TASTY! The fresh summer pork roll was DELICATE and SPICY!  

Very authentic, flavorful, high quality ingredients and great service! I wish them much success and hope more people would discover this place.

excerpts: My mom and I got the lemongrass beef with vermicelli noodles, and a plate of fried tofu with spring rolls.
The tofu was perfectly crisp with fried onion on top, and the spring roll was fresh and delicious!
There was also a small side of salad.
The portions were perfect for me.
The lemongrass beef was also tasty, not too fatty.
I think the vermicelli noodles were pretty standard, though the egg rolls were great, crunchy and mouthwatering.
vermicelli.author: Vivian L.
vermicelli.review:
Came across this place during lunch hours while walking through Clement, and it's a cute little restaurant with an elegant atmosphere. I love Vietnamese food, and their French-Vietnamese fusion is interesting and yummy! 

Before serving your actual order, they bring a small soup/chowder that's tangy and flavorful. Not really sure what was in it, but it tasted like tomatoes and a bit of onion. I really wanted to ask for seconds! My mom and I got the lemongrass beef with vermicelli noodles, and a plate of fried tofu with spring rolls. The tofu was perfectly crisp with fried onion on top, and the spring roll was fresh and delicious! There was also a small side of salad. The portions were perfect for me. The lemongrass beef was also tasty, not too fatty. I think the vermicelli noodles were pretty standard, though the egg rolls were great, crunchy and mouthwatering. 

The price range is a bit expensive for what you get, but I'd say that's a given as it's in SF and the place is pretty nice, clean, and fancy. Customer service is also friendly and quick. Check it out if you're in the area and can't choose where to eat!

excerpts: $7: got the pork and shrimp one wrapped with vermicelli and rice paper served with peanut sauce and like some sriracha sauce in the middle?
Damn, I died because I cannot handle any type of sauce.
But the spring rolls itself were just ok.... not super authentic and not very flavorful as the ones I am used to.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=c7UIg8hi2DEABVpkFnM09A#Y3aSw8ymGAopZ2xPQ-PWeA
All in all, as everyone mentioned, and upscale Vietnamese restaurant with some French influences.
A bit pricey, but still affordable.
vermicelli.author: Chena N.
vermicelli.review:
As I was driving to Le Solei, I joked with my very traditional mother (the one who refuses to eat anything except Vietnamese food) over the phone and told her I was going to eat Vietnamese food made by a European guy. She flipped. "WHY... would you do that? It doesn't even sound good already. You should only eat Vietnamese food made by Vietnamese people" HELLA JUDGING OR WHAT MAMA N. I told her not to be so judgmental because fusion food can be pretty good sometimes. AND IT IS DEFINITELY GOOD! BTW, the chefs were not European. 

Le Solei brings in a modern angle of Vietnamese cuisine paired with French influences. Loved the décor as it consisted of intricate things like the ABACUS on their wall... WHAT? Ahah I thought it was super clever. 

Garlic Roasted Dungeness crab (half crab) $25: Dungeness crab pan fried in browned butter and garlic with egg noodles. The essence of the crab developed the flavors so well coupled with the delicious noodles that were smothered in browned garlic & butter. I actually quite liked this plate. It came with the crab cracker which was great because I already broke my tooth once biting onto a crab, it aint happenin again. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=c7UIg8hi2DEABVpkFnM09A#sZwYlLrELTJTm5TCQkxGjw

Luc Lac "Shaken Beef" $16:  Wok tossed flank steak over rice (more like over a lettuce and a bowl of rice on the side... BUT...)  served with lemon pepper butter sauce. LEMME TELL YA... this beef was tender like tender could ever be. Like the cow had a full on body massage and acupuncture or something before it became my food. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=c7UIg8hi2DEABVpkFnM09A#c7UIg8hi2DEABVpkFnM09A

Fresh Spring Rolls $7: got the pork and shrimp one wrapped with vermicelli and rice paper served with peanut sauce and like some sriracha sauce in the middle? Damn, I died because I cannot handle any type of sauce. But the spring rolls itself were just ok.... not super authentic and not very flavorful as the ones I am used to. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=c7UIg8hi2DEABVpkFnM09A#Y3aSw8ymGAopZ2xPQ-PWeA
 
All in all, as everyone mentioned, and upscale Vietnamese restaurant with some French influences. A bit pricey, but still affordable.

excerpts:
After checking out the menu, we ordered:

Imperial Rolls - the rolls were lightly fried and consisted of pork, mushroom, carrots and served with vermicelli, shredded carrots and dichon and lettuce and mint with fish sauce on the side.
vermicelli.author: Al L.
vermicelli.review:
Le Soleil calls its cuisine New Vietnamese, a blend of Vietnamese and French styles. Its small, modern décor location on Clement St. is a perfect backdrop to showcase this Vietnamese fusion cuisine. 

The menu is not a multi-page listing, but one page with selections of appetizers, salads, soups and entrees.  After checking out the menu, we ordered:

Imperial Rolls - the rolls were lightly fried and consisted of pork, mushroom, carrots and served with vermicelli, shredded carrots and dichon and lettuce and mint with fish sauce on the side.  Wrap the roll in lettuce with the condiments and drizzle some fish sauce on it for a delicious appetizer. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=k9JRJAbcvQN3eebvGxTZsw#k9JRJAbcvQN3eebvGxTZsw)

Green Papaya Shrimp salad - shrimp, green papaya, carrots, mint, tamarind sauce.  A refreshing salad that has hint of sweetness from the tamarind sauce.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=k9JRJAbcvQN3eebvGxTZsw#RJ1Y4cU5b90Yn8N1M_N5tg)

House Fried Rice - duck and pineapple stirred fried with scallions and garlic.   Tasty fried rice with the minced duck.  
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=k9JRJAbcvQN3eebvGxTZsw#w9aePtdybcTgWGXxePIenQ)

Curry Short Ribs - braised boneless short ribs in yellow curry with potatoes, carrots and lime leaf served with garlic bread.  This was my favorite dish.  The short ribs were probably lightly fried creating a nice light crust to it. The beef was so tender and tasty with the coconut milk curry sauce.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/le-soleil-san-francisco?select=k9JRJAbcvQN3eebvGxTZsw#hY4bqKQNh1odO2yQWZH02Q)

A nice place on Clement for tasty New Vietnamese cuisine in a nice modern décor with friendly service.

excerpts: Not your typical Vietnamese joint with mainly pho and vermicelli, Le Soleil actually deviates a lot from the traditional Vietnamese foods to more specialty items.
vermicelli.author: Alysha F.
vermicelli.review:
An interesting find in the City. Not your typical Vietnamese joint with mainly pho and vermicelli, Le Soleil actually deviates a lot from the traditional Vietnamese foods to more specialty items. 

There's a decent amount of street parking along the entire block which is convenient. The decor of the restaurant is classy without being uptight. We got the Shrimp Rice Krispies for appetizers which didn't have a whole lot of flavor and kinda had a weird texture but was cool to try. For my dinner I got the Caramelized Sea Bass and it was delicious. It was a soy glazed sea bass with a side of brussel sprouts and rice. The sea bass was packed with flavor without being fishy. I would definitely not mind paying Le Soleil another visit

excerpts: I ordered the pork over vermicelli ($9), which was not bad at all.
The pho is also "not bad", the spring rolls a little bit bland.
Their clay pot rice also lacks flavor (but I've been spoiled by authentic ones) but everything is served piping hot, so that's a plus.
vermicelli.author: Maggie G.
vermicelli.review:
Food: 3 stars
Service: 3 stars

On every level, this place deserves a "A-OK". I ordered the pork over vermicelli ($9), which was not bad at all. The pho is also "not bad", the spring rolls a little bit bland. Their clay pot rice also lacks flavor (but I've been spoiled by authentic ones) but everything is served piping hot, so that's a plus. The restaurant itself is very clean, and we loved that they serve fresh coconuts ($4).

Come by for a good lunch place to chat over Vietnamese fusion food :-)

excerpts: Since it comes with a fish oil based sauce, it basically reminds me of vietnamese vermicelli, but without the noodle, meats, or chicken.
Great fried onion taste, and
vermicelli.author: Lily N.
vermicelli.review:
We tried the soft shelled crab, which was really good and perfectly fried!  Had a nice lemony sauce that nicey complimented this cute dish.

The lotus root salad is also a MUST get!  Since it comes with a fish oil based sauce, it basically reminds me of vietnamese vermicelli, but without the noodle, meats, or chicken.  Great fried onion taste, and it's super healthy with all those root veggies.

Their 5 spice chicken is always veery tender and has a great flavor (I also very much like the fish sauce it comes with).

Their shaken beef is okay.  It's not bad, but I was expecting something more tender.

Lastly, for dessert, we tried the mango sticky rice.  The waiter really undersold this one, so I had my expectations low.  I've personally never had real mango sticky rice, and my friend said that is better.  But from somebody who's never tried it, I thought this fusion version was actually very tasty and interesting.

Overall, a little bit on the fancy side, so their apps and desserts, please expect small.  But their entrees are very generous proportions, and everything is very well-presented.

The overall flavor for every savory item is definitely citrus-- you'll find it in the sauces often.  Even their water is infused with orange and lemon.

excerpts:
Food:
Spring roll
Lunch special beef over vermicelli noodles
vermicelli.author: Angela L.
vermicelli.review:
Food:
Spring roll
Lunch special beef over vermicelli noodles
Came w creamy soup


SERVICE
Good

ATMOSPHERE
Simple clean can tell a designer had his touch on the place.

excerpts: We started with the combination appetizer plate which came with imperial rolls, strips of bbq lemon grass beef and grilled prawns served atop vermicelli noodles with scallions.
Accompanied by a platter of fresh greenleaf lettuce, shaved carrots, fresh mint, fish sauce and rice papers to wrap it all up in.
We were there at dinnertime, but wanted rice vermicelli noodle bowls, which weren't on the dinner menu.
The servers were completely accommodating to our request and graciously whipped up a couple of bowls.
In fact, the service was very attentive and polite, and they seemed genuinely interested in our reaction to the food and restaurant.
Reasonably priced too: mom and I feasted on hefty portions, all for a little over $30.
The place appeared to be clean too, even the bathrooms.
This restaurant certainly deserves all the accolades it seems to have collected on its walls over the years.
vermicelli.author: Rick H.
vermicelli.review:
This is upscale Vietnamese cuisine by Clement Street standards and the best Vietnamese food I've had in the City.

Warm, pleasant ambiance with nice track lighting and pretty wood tables inset with glass cases holding decorative pieces.  The food is outstanding.  We started with the combination appetizer plate which came with imperial rolls, strips of bbq lemon grass beef and grilled prawns served atop vermicelli noodles with scallions.  Accompanied by a platter of fresh greenleaf lettuce, shaved carrots, fresh mint, fish sauce and rice papers to wrap it all up in.

We were there at dinnertime, but wanted rice vermicelli noodle bowls, which weren't on the dinner menu.  The servers were completely accommodating to our request and graciously whipped up a couple of bowls.  In fact, the service was very attentive and polite, and they seemed genuinely interested in our reaction to the food and restaurant.

Reasonably priced too: mom and I feasted on hefty portions, all for a little over $30.  The place appeared to be clean too, even the bathrooms.

This restaurant certainly deserves all the accolades it seems to have collected on its walls over the years.

excerpts: I always like it when restaurants serve their imperial rolls with this and the pickled carrots and vermicelli.)
vermicelli.author: jason g.
vermicelli.review:
What a great day for Pho!!!  Came here today with one of my workers and Tony H, from Hard Knox.  I told him that I am going to teach him how to eat Vietnamese food...........him being Vietnamese and I being Chinese was already kinda funny.  A Vietnamese guy who owns a soul food restaurant being taught how to eat Vietnamese food from a Chinese guy who sells insurance.  A great comedy in the making. Onto the food..............

Imperial roll (this is the way you are suppose to make traditional rolls.  Rice paper!!! The lettuce and mint leaves were super fresh.  I always like it when restaurants serve their imperial rolls with this and the pickled carrots and vermicelli.) 8.50

Vietnamese potstickers ..(exact same ingredients as the imperial rolls but with crispy rice flakes.  It's different.  Just stick with the imperial roll)
8.50

3 bowls of Pho dac biet 8.50 each.  Broth is awesome.  You can tell that this base has been marinading.  Beef and tendons are of very high quality.

Total 47.00

I didn't treat so it tasted even better. hahahah.  Thanks Tony H. for the meal.   Like Mai H said.............I don't mind paying a little bit more for this quality of food.  Plus she was the one that recommended this restaurant to me.  This restaurant will run you 15% more than your mom and pop places but it is well worth it.

The service was awesome.  The water was refilled all the time and the food came out in a timely manner.  You can always tell from a great Vietnamese restaurant by their fresh condiments.  I think they might even grow the stuff themselves.  

Overall.  An excellent lunch.

excerpts: 3)Lemon grass pork chop vermicelli: 3.5 stars.
Good taste, nothing stands out.
4)Cube beef streak(Lok Luc): 2.5 stars.
Not many restaurants do this right.
vermicelli.author: SP Y.
vermicelli.review:
We walked in on a Saturday afternoon and they were relatively empty compare to other restaurant around. We decided to try anyway.

We ordered:
1)Imperial roll: 5 stars. Execellent taste, very crispy, mint leaves are fresh like we never seen.
2)Rice crepe: 4 stars. Very tasty. Would have been a 5 stars if it wasn't for the Imperial roll. Crispy, fresh, just right.
3)Lemon grass pork chop vermicelli: 3.5 stars. Good taste, nothing stands out.
4)Cube beef streak(Lok Luc): 2.5 stars. Not many restaurants do this right. But, this dish is my ultimate test. 

Waiters are 5 Stars for this class of restaurants. Very nice and attentive, could be because of the slow day.

Overall: 3.5 stars if possible.

excerpts: So the dish I was craving you ask....the vermicelli bowl with pork and imperial rolls with the fish sauce - yah, you know it.
I'd try to spell it
but I'd probably butcher and offend someone.
The restaurant actually had all the ingredients for it but didn't offer it on the menu....
Otherwise, they just may have received 5 stars.
vermicelli.author: Josephine H.
vermicelli.review:
I would have given this place 5 stars if it had the one and only dish I was craving. We came to Le Soleil b'c our original pick was too crowded but I wasn't disappointed at all. Le Soleil had a great selection but not overwhelming menu of appetizers, soups, meats, vegetarian dishes, noodles and rice. We started off with the corn, asparagus, and crab soup. This was good after we added a little white pepper. A little thick but still tasty. The imperial rolls are definitely a must order for any vietnamese restaurant and definitely this place. The marinated and sliced pork and shaking beef were excellent choices! The meat was flavorful and tender. The garlic butter noodles with egg was also a nice complement. 

Service was excellent and very friendly!

So the dish I was craving you ask....the vermicelli bowl with pork and imperial rolls with the fish sauce - yah, you know it. I'd try to spell it but I'd probably butcher and offend someone. The restaurant actually had all the ingredients for it but didn't offer it on the menu.... Otherwise, they just may have received 5 stars.

excerpts: bo nuong cha gio BBQ beef and imperial rolls with vermicelli noodles
, it comes with a small soup!
The price is reasonable and the the service is very good!
vermicelli.author: Kim L.
vermicelli.review: We love Le Soleil restaurant. My daughter love eating meat ball noodle soup every time she comes here and she is almost 3 years old. She said Pho was so yummy. The soup tastes so fresh and delicious. I love roasted crab with garlic noodles, my favorite! My husband love the lunch menu, he always orders Bun bo nuong cha gio BBQ beef and imperial rolls with vermicelli noodles, it comes with a small soup! The price is reasonable and the the service is very good!

excerpts: My  grilled beef vermicelli was just ok...
vermicelli.author: Luci B.
vermicelli.review:
I was excited to go here because the place is so cute.  However I was disappointed...my imperial rolls tasted like flour.  Those are my favorite part, so it really ruined the rest of my meal.  My  grilled beef vermicelli was just ok...I've definately had better....but it was better than the rolls.

I really like the atmosphere in here though.

excerpts: I ate the lemongrass beef with vermicelli.
The quality is ok.
You play extra $ for the atmosphere and also the better appearance.
I have been told they just renovation recently.
vermicelli.author: Westcott S.
vermicelli.review: I ate the lemongrass beef with vermicelli. The quality is ok. You play extra $ for the atmosphere and also the better appearance. I have been told they just renovation recently.

excerpts: this place makes the best vermicelli with vietnamese style bbq pork, and fried imperial rolls.
unlike a lot of vietnamese places in the tenderloin, the imperial rolls here come out fresh tasting instead of rancid (due to stale and overused oil in the fryer).
their rolls are also REALLY tightly packed, so they come out with a nice firm texture, instead of the oily, loosely packed rolls you get at most other places that end up falling apart.
their dinners are also outstanding.
vermicelli.author: Curtis Y.
vermicelli.review: this place makes the best vermicelli with vietnamese style bbq pork, and fried imperial rolls.  unlike a lot of vietnamese places in the tenderloin, the imperial rolls here come out fresh tasting instead of rancid (due to stale and overused oil in the fryer).  their rolls are also REALLY tightly packed, so they come out with a nice firm texture, instead of the oily, loosely packed rolls you get at most other places that end up falling apart.  their dinners are also outstanding.  i highly recommend the fish curry, the eggplant, the dry cooked green beans, and the vietnamese crepes (for lunch or dinner).  the crispy vietnamese crepes (made out of a mung bean batter, and infused with yummy coconut milk, and filled with sprouts, chicken, shrimp, and topped with fresh mint, et al are heavenly.

excerpts: Would recommend Imperial rolls, Spring rolls, Green Papaya Salad, Sizzling Seafood, Halibut...do not miss the garlic noodles and green beans (two different dishes) that are in small type at the bottom: they are great!
I have never tried the crab, but it looks AMAZING!
green beans.author: Robyn H.
green beans.review: I have been to this restaurant a dozen times as I live in the neighborhood. The service is perfect....but it is really all about the food. It is incredible: delicious, fresh, and creative. There are plenty of veggie & fish dishes. I have tried most things on the menu and haven't encounter anything that wasn't fabulous. The price is really reasonable considering the quality of the food. Would recommend Imperial rolls, Spring rolls, Green Papaya Salad, Sizzling Seafood, Halibut...do not miss the garlic noodles and green beans (two different dishes) that are in small type at the bottom: they are great! I have never tried the crab, but it looks AMAZING!

excerpts:
if you dip them in the fish sauce but not necessary 4/5
-Seabass: Sea bass on a bed of green beans and broccoli.
Pretty tasty, it was my mom and sister's favorite.
The fish had a semi crispy exterior and was seasoned really well.

4/5
-Shaking beef
: This was my favorite dish, the beef was soooo tender and well seasoned!
Meat is more on the medium well side
but it was amazingly tender.
Really good with rice or on it's own.
-5 spice chicken:
Cooked well where the meat is still juicy
but I didn't really care all that much for it.
Nothing much to rave about.

3/5
-Lychee black tea:
Whoa this was super yummy, not overly sweet and you can really taste the lychee undertone!
green beans.author: Kelly L.
green beans.review:
Decided to take my family here for Father's day dinner. Restaurant was not full so reservations was not necessary. 

We ordered the following dishes:
-Garlic Crab: You can opt in for a whole crab or just half an order, also comes with a bed of garlic noodles that was tossed with the crab fat. The crab wasn't very meaty but the sauce was tasty. Garlic noodles reminded me of packaged ramen, would've preferred a chubbier noodle. The crab came precracked so it was super easy to open and eat. 4/5
-Curry Veggies: Thai curry with veggies bathing in it. Veggies included potatoes, broccoli, oyster mushroom &  tofu. Super tasty curry that went really well with rice. My sister loved the oyster mushrooms the most. 4/5 
-Imperial rolls: Tasted like your typical imperial rolls, fried really well, crispy on the outside, hot on the inside. 4/5
-Side of shrimp chips: My brother loves shrimp chips, so I ordered some for him and everyone loved it. Pretty tasty if you dip them in the fish sauce but not necessary 4/5
-Seabass: Sea bass on a bed of green beans and broccoli. Pretty tasty, it was my mom and sister's favorite. The fish had a semi crispy exterior and was seasoned really well. 4/5
-Shaking beef: This was my favorite dish, the beef was soooo tender and well seasoned! Meat is more on the medium well side but it was amazingly tender. Really good with rice or on it's own. 5/5
-5 spice chicken: Cooked well where the meat is still juicy but I didn't really care all that much for it. Nothing much to rave about. 3/5
-Lychee black tea: Whoa this was super yummy, not overly sweet and you can really taste the lychee undertone! 5/5


This place was yummy but it's definitely pricier than your typical Vietnamese cuisine. Would definitely come back to try other dishes.

excerpts: - Portobello Mushrooms with green beans and Brussels - I could had just eaten this dish alone with a bowl of rice and would had been content!
The portobello shrooms soaked up all the flavors of the sauce, it was tender beyond belief and could easily pass as a protein dish.
The green beans and Brussels were cooked with a slight crunchy texture and was so delicious to eat.
green beans.author: Jenny T.
green beans.review:
Le Soleil serves traditional Vietnamese cuisine in a quant modernized dining room.  All the wait staff wears black and are extremely friendly.  It's a perfect place to dine for a celebratory reason or for just because...

We booked easily online and was seated right away.  The tables are small and we could barely fit all the dishes served up for us for family style dining.  Or maybe we were just little piggies and should be ordering individual dishes instead.  But none the less, we are Asians, that's just how we roll. Banquet family style is more our to our upbringing.  Plus, we are piggies that wanna taste everything!!  

Each dish that came out was delightfully scumcious!  And here we goooo...

5 STARS - SUPER YUM
! - Lotus root beef salad - the lotus was crunchy with bits of marinated beef drizzled with a light tangy flavor
! - Beef carpaccio with shrimp chips - thinly sliced raw beef with a tangy lime sauce topped with a peppery chopped red onions with deep fried shallots.  You're supposed to eat this with the shrimp chip but I prefer to roll a beef up with onions and shallots, then pop it into my mouth.  It's a explosion of yummies in your mouth
! - Portobello Mushrooms with green beans and Brussels - I could had just eaten this dish alone with a bowl of rice and would had been content!  The portobello shrooms soaked up all the flavors of the sauce, it was tender beyond belief and could easily pass as a protein dish.  The green beans and Brussels were cooked with a slight crunchy texture and was so delicious to eat.  Yum!!

4 STARS - GOOD YUM
! - Shanking beef - this was marinated beef with a lemon pepper dipping sauce.  I wish the sauce had more pepper and lemon, it was a bit drowned out for me
! - Garlic crab with noodles - The crab meat was very fresh but it's not my favorite crab dish.  The noodles were good but again, I've had better.
! - Coconut lemon grass chicken soup - the broth was so good but I thought the chicken got in my way.  I love how there were pineapples found in the soup.

2.5 STARS - OKAY
! - BBQ pork spring rolls - it was okay, nothing special

We each had a glass of wine: Merlot, Sauvignon blanc, Pinot noir, Cabernet 

And the owner found out we were celebrating a birthday and he offered us a free dessert of flan with a lite candle.  That was so nice!

All this came out to $131+tip.  For a birthday celebration, this was a decent outcome, as we've spent wayyy more before.  And we were all content and extremely full!

NOTES:  no cocktail drinks available.  Dessert menu was kinda lame, they need to amp that part up.  Parking was not exactly easy.

excerpts: Portobello Mushroom: on the dinner menu and comes with three mushrooms and green beans in what tasted like an oyster sauce.
green beans.author: Lauren Y.
green beans.review:
Sweet place for a contemporary take on Vietnamese cuisine. We came for lunch but ordered from the dinner menu because the dishes were much better.

What to order:
Shaken beef: super tender beef cubes with softened onions

Beef carpaccio: came with yummy shrimp chips.. Was a smaller portion than usual and a bit too minty for my taste but overall good

Portobello Mushroom: on the dinner menu and comes with three mushrooms and green beans in what tasted like an oyster sauce. Tasty. 

Vietnamese ice coffee: standard faire.. If you haven't had it before, Viet coffee always comes with a nice kick and condensed milk ;)

What to think twice about:
Traditional pho - the broth was decent but could have used more of it in the bowl. Decent pho but I believe you can better elsewhere. Go for their more standout dishes! 


Service was nothing outstanding. Our server forgot our order of garlic noodles and seemed kind of grumpy. Really enjoyed the dinner entrees.

excerpts: Prawn noodles, green beans, beef were highlights.
green beans.author: Mike L.
green beans.review:
Update 2015

Came back and had a great meal here, everything was very tasty. Prawn noodles, green beans, beef were highlights. Unusually for Vietnamese restaurants, they don't really have pho 


---

Tasty and a tad expensive. The sea bass was amazing, everything else was good but the flavors are all kind of the same.

excerpts: We ordered the lemongrass pork chops, Green beans and chicken fried rice.
The pork chops I had were a lil dry-esque for some, but for me I didn't mind it well done to a crisp.
I kinda like it like that, sprinkle some of that Vietnamese sauce sauce and your good to go.
green beans.author: Kris C.
green beans.review:
I've eaten here twice. The first time was take out for lunch. I had the pho and my friends had a couple of other dishes. All in all I liked.

Then I went for dinner this past Saturday (Dined In), They have a more upscale fancier menu for dinner time. At first I was a little eh, because I wanted my Bun Bo Thit Nuong. Instead I ordered a couple of a la carte dishes and I must say it was quite delish.

We ordered the lemongrass pork chops, Green beans and chicken fried rice. The pork chops I had were a lil dry-esque for some, but for me I didn't mind it well done to a crisp. I kinda like it like that, sprinkle some of that Vietnamese sauce sauce and your good to go.

excerpts: We had the sea bass with the garlic and soy green beans.
green beans.author: Amy M.
green beans.review:
My coworker had been raving about this place for weeks.  For awhile I  think she was eating there weekly.  I was leaving work just as she was craving the bass so we walked real fast cuz it was real cold to Le Soleil.

The interior is lovely.  (Although I am still wondering how the framed Roman columns fit in with the otherwise Asian decor.) Our table had what appeared to be three small perfume bottles embedded in the center under glass.  

I didn't examine the menu as completely as normal since we knew that we were going to order blocks before arriving. 

We had the sea bass with the garlic and soy green beans.  Sooo good.

Bonus points for offering brown (it looked more red than brown) rice in addition to white rice.

The service was good, but a little sloppy with the water.  Our glasses were frequently filled, but a big splash of water was added to our tableclothless table with every pour.

And wear a sweater because it was chilly in there.

excerpts:
Soy & Garlic Green Beans - Pretty good.
Pan Fried Rice Noodles with Chicken - Pretty good.
green beans.author: Sandy L.
green beans.review:
Yum. I wanna come back. 

We had:
Imperial Rolls - Good, although slightly burned for some pieces.
Some beef thing - I can't remember which one but it was GOOD.
Hot & Sour Soup of Catfish - Catfish was yummy; not a huge fan of the soup.
Five Spice Chicken - Delicious!
Crab Fried Rice - Yummm.
Soy & Garlic Green Beans - Pretty good.
Pan Fried Rice Noodles with Chicken - Pretty good.
Garlic Butter Noodles - Alright, wasn't a big fan.

As for drinks, I was disappointed that thai iced tea was almost $4. Didn't even know if I could've swallowed some thai iced tea that was $4.

But I will be back for that beef! If I can figure out which one it was...and for some scallops!

excerpts:
We got:

Garlic noodles: a MUST
Appetizer Sampler: marinated steak, imperial rolls (!!!!!!), shrimp with all the fixins (lettuce, pickled vegis, mint, etc)
Beef with green beans
Chicken dish - ground chicken with peppers.
green beans.author: Yee-Shing W.
green beans.review:
Not cheap but very very delicious food. Some of the menu items borrow Thai and Chinese flavors which makes it interesting. Everything we ordered was fantastic. We got:

Garlic noodles: a MUST
Appetizer Sampler: marinated steak, imperial rolls (!!!!!!), shrimp with all the fixins (lettuce, pickled vegis, mint, etc)
Beef with green beans
Chicken dish - ground chicken with peppers. spicy!
Mango salad - highly recommend
Sauteed tofu and vegis - eh, okay

Favorites definitely were the garlic noodles and imperial rolls. Great place for a sit-down Vietnamese lunch or dinner.

excerpts: For example, the green beans with garlic sauce dish (over $10) we ordered can literally be eaten in 3 bites, and I am only 160 lbs.
There were 6 of us eating family style dinner.
This type of dinning typically leaves you too full to walk out with plenty to take home.
But no, not this place.
We averaged over $20 each and had to order some plain white rice (with some free soy sauce) just because we were still hungry...
Oh
yeah, we had to go to the kitchen to tell them what we wanted because service was slow.
Again, food is not bad.
But if you want even better vietnamese cuisine and more PORTIONS and reasonable price, go to Dragonfly on Sunset.
My 1.5 cents
green beans.author: Mike H.
green beans.review:
I can't honestly say the food is bad.  However, there is nothing that gets me more upset than a restaurant that charges you an arm and a leg and leaves you hungry!!!  For example, the green beans with garlic sauce dish (over $10) we ordered can literally be eaten in 3 bites, and I am only 160 lbs.  There were 6 of us eating family style dinner.  This type of dinning typically leaves you too full to walk out with plenty to take home.  But no, not this place.  We averaged over $20 each and had to order some plain white rice (with some free soy sauce) just because we were still hungry...   Oh yeah, we had to go to the kitchen to tell them what we wanted because service was slow.

Again, food is not bad.  But if you want even better vietnamese cuisine and more PORTIONS and reasonable price, go to Dragonfly on Sunset.  

My 1.5 cents

excerpts: The mixed vegetables were only so-so but the meat and green beans were also yummy though not as spicy as we excepted.
The decor was nice though the bathroom didn't feel completely finished.
The service was good.
green beans.author: Sesily M.
green beans.review: We had a wonderful meal at le soleil last night.  The coconut soup was delicious and complex.  The appetizer platter was great: the meat was wonderful with a lovely grilled flavor.  The mixed vegetables were only so-so but the meat and green beans were also yummy though not as spicy as we excepted.  The decor was nice though the bathroom didn't feel completely finished.  The service was good.

excerpts: beans(4 pieces of beef and the rest green beans and red chili).
Very expensive and very trick.....Please make your money worth it.
Go to Q, Burma,Clementine, Giorgio's etc....
green beans.author: Mia S.
green beans.review: . Of course we tried Burma and B X. Anyway we finished trying Le Soleil. They were very trick with our pretend meal. We asked for garlic noodles with shrimp and we got a little amount of noodles with four shrimps.Fried rice with crab (just a bit of crab and rest rice), fried beef with greens beans(4 pieces of beef and the rest green beans and red chili). Very expensive and very trick.....Please make your money worth it. Go to Q, Burma,Clementine, Giorgio's etc....

excerpts: the chicken was really tasty, not dry at all and the green beans were cooked just right no soggy green beans I thoroughly enjoyed it, but...... the portion was way too small for the price, like I said earlier.
I could get more and something that tastes better for a fraction of the cost down the street.
Don't get me wrong, the plate was esthetically pleasing and the the rice plate was not absurdly expensive, but for the price somewhere else, I would've have more on my little plate.
When my bf's bowl of Bun Bo Hue arrived, we were pleasantly surprised, but not in a good way.
You know how when the Bun Bo Hue arrives and it's piping hot  with that spicy oil floating on the top of the broth?
He had none of that going on, none at all.
The broth was the blandest that I have ever tasted.
He had to add a whole lot of hot sauce, but you know what that did?
It just made the bowl of soup taste just like watery Sriracha.
Very disappointing.
The service was super slow.
When he asked for the hot sauce, he waited and waited.
I was practically done with my rice plate before the hot sauce came.
Half the restaurant was filled, it was not super busy and there were also two waiters.
All in all, I would probably not come back here again, not for the service or the food, which is too bad, since we both really wanted to like this restaurant.
green beans.author: carebear l.
green beans.review: Oh how my bf and I wanted to really like this restaurant. We came here for a late lunch the other day. We've seen this place and have driven by so many times. I guess we had really high expectations for this place and thought that it would be like upscale Vietnamese cuisine. Why pay more for Vietnamese food if you can get something tastier down the street for a way better price?Not sure, but we thought that we would just try it. The decor in this restaurant is lovely, but that seems to be the only thing that they have going for them. We walked into the restaurant and waited for someone to acknowledge us. Took a bit, but I guess I was expecting too much? We were seated and were handed our menus. It was interesting that the menu was in English only. My bf wanted to order Bun Bo Hue, but we couldn't tell which item it was on the menu(depending on where you go, it's called something different in English), but if it was in Vietnamese we wouldn't have had a problem. I guess it didn't matter since my bf ordered in Vietnamese anyway. I ordered the lemon grass chicken over rice. My rice plate came out first. I was pleasantly surprised.... the chicken was really tasty, not dry at all and the green beans were cooked just right no soggy green beans I thoroughly enjoyed it, but...... the portion was way too small for the price, like I said earlier. I could get more and something that tastes better for a fraction of the cost down the street. Don't get me wrong, the plate was esthetically pleasing and the the rice plate was not absurdly expensive, but for the price somewhere else, I would've have more on my little plate. When my bf's bowl of Bun Bo Hue arrived, we were pleasantly surprised, but not in a good way. You know how when the Bun Bo Hue arrives and it's piping hot  with that spicy oil floating on the top of the broth? He had none of that going on, none at all. The broth was the blandest that I have ever tasted. He had to add a whole lot of hot sauce, but you know what that did? It just made the bowl of soup taste just like watery Sriracha. Very disappointing. The service was super slow. When he asked for the hot sauce, he waited and waited. I was practically done with my rice plate before the hot sauce came. Half the restaurant was filled, it was not super busy and there were also two waiters. All in all, I would probably not come back here again, not for the service or the food, which is too bad, since we both really wanted to like this restaurant.

excerpts: i highly recommend the fish curry, the eggplant, the dry cooked green beans, and the vietnamese crepes (for lunch or dinner).
the crispy vietnamese crepes (made out of a mung bean batter, and infused with yummy coconut milk, and filled with sprouts, chicken, shrimp, and topped with fresh mint, et al are heavenly.
green beans.author: Curtis Y.
green beans.review: this place makes the best vermicelli with vietnamese style bbq pork, and fried imperial rolls.  unlike a lot of vietnamese places in the tenderloin, the imperial rolls here come out fresh tasting instead of rancid (due to stale and overused oil in the fryer).  their rolls are also REALLY tightly packed, so they come out with a nice firm texture, instead of the oily, loosely packed rolls you get at most other places that end up falling apart.  their dinners are also outstanding.  i highly recommend the fish curry, the eggplant, the dry cooked green beans, and the vietnamese crepes (for lunch or dinner).  the crispy vietnamese crepes (made out of a mung bean batter, and infused with yummy coconut milk, and filled with sprouts, chicken, shrimp, and topped with fresh mint, et al are heavenly.

excerpts: I had the lemon chicken and it came with green beans which were excellent.
The dessert was lovely too.
The portions were plentiful and were tastefully presented.
The service was attentive but not intrusive.
I would definitely recommend Le Soleil to people, based on my experience alone.
I was being treated to lunch so cannot accurately make a comment on pricing, although I did not think it was expensive when I first looked at the menu.
Bon Appetite.
green beans.author: mary f.
green beans.review: Had lunch here the other day with a friend and the food was very good. Lovely decor and the bathroom was clean (a good indication that a restaurant cares about the whole package, so to speak). I had the lemon chicken and it came with green beans which were excellent. The dessert was lovely too. The portions were plentiful and were tastefully presented. The service was attentive but not intrusive. I would definitely recommend Le Soleil to people, based on my experience alone. I was being treated to lunch so cannot accurately make a comment on pricing, although I did not think it was expensive when I first looked at the menu. Bon Appetite.

excerpts: I was intrigued to see something like Escargot Noodle Soup.
Every dish looks enticing that I want to sample them all.
We ordered a lot for just three people.
We started off with some appetizers.
We had the Escargot Noodle Soup, Beef Pho, Roast Duck & Pineapple Fried Rice and Chicken & Shrimp Crispy Noodle.
The food presents well with a touch of fusion look (see photos).
My husband will die for the Imperial Rolls.
I fell in love with the crispy noodle dish.
The food was amazing.
It is so good that I'm giving this place 5 stars.
I want to add another star for excellent service if I could give it 6 stars.
escargot noodle soup.author: Anita S.
escargot noodle soup.review:
This restaurant is right in the heart of Richmond close to all the stores on Clement Street.  Upon entering the restaurant I was shocked to see how beautiful the interior is.  It is elegantly decorated and it has a zen like feel.  I feel comfortable and very relax right away.  

The menu offers many unique dishes.  I was intrigued to see something like Escargot Noodle Soup.  Every dish looks enticing that I want to sample them all.  We ordered a lot for just three people.  We started off with some appetizers.  Shrimp Rice Krispies  and it was served with peanut sauce like many other Vietnamese restaurants but the presentation here is very pretty.  The  Imperial Roll is like no others, it is authentic not a Spring Roll wanna be Imperial Roll. 

We ordered their lunch special  Lemongrass Beef served with Chicken Coconut Soup for $10.  We had the Escargot Noodle Soup, Beef Pho, Roast Duck & Pineapple Fried Rice and Chicken & Shrimp Crispy Noodle.  The food presents well with a touch of fusion look (see photos).  My husband will die for the Imperial Rolls.  I fell in love with the crispy noodle dish.   The food was amazing. It is so good that I'm giving this place 5 stars.   I want to add another star for excellent service if I could give it 6 stars.

excerpts: We had Laksa Noodle Soup, Chicken Noodle Soup & Traditional Noodle Soup and all were delicious.
We all agreed we will come back.
laksa noodle soup.author: Kevin K.
laksa noodle soup.review: We had Laksa Noodle Soup, Chicken Noodle Soup & Traditional Noodle Soup and all were delicious.  We all agreed we will come back.
